story:
Idea

The Moto Z brings modularity to a whole new level. You may be aware of some of the existing Moto mods available and the functionality that they provide. The Storage Mod takes that a step further making your smartphones very productive.

Storage

The Storage Mod comes with a built-in memory , which acts as the external hard drive attached to the back of your Moto Z smartphone .The mod can be configured as per user requirements  and is available in 32GB , 64GB , 128GB and 256GB variants.

Battery 

The Storage Mod comes with a 2800mAh battery giving you an extra 6hrs of onscreen time for your Moto Z .

The Storage Mod can be configured by your Moto Z for your charging preferences. You can set either default mode to keep your phone at 100% charge, or efficiency mode to keep your phone at 80% battery while helping The Storage Mod to last longer.

I/O Ports

The Storage Mod is equipped with a bunch of I/O ports. Any USB devices can be connected to the Mod. The portability of a laptop and the power of a desktop computer can be achieved just by connecting the mod along with the moto z to any available display via an  HDMI cable. With the AUX port and the Micro-USB port, you can now listen to music and charge the device at the same time.

Faster data transfer and quick charge is supported by the USB Type -C.

 

QI Wireles Charging & IR Remote

The Mod features  QI certified wireless charging capability allowing it to charge through any wireless charger and can also be used as a TV Remote.

Dedicated SDXC Card Reader

The Mod has a built-in SDXC Card Reader for photographer's ,video editors and other professionals. It empowers them to edit ,view , share , backup pictures-videos, on the go without the need of any extension cables or dongles.

 

Moto Z Storage Mod specifications

Compatibility: Moto Z, Z Force, Z Play, Z Droid

Memory Options: 32GB, 64GB, 128GB, 256GB

I/O Ports: USB-A, USB-C, HDMI, Micro-USB, AUX Port, SDXC Card Reader

Battery Backup: 2800 mAh

Wireless Charging: QI Certified Wireless Charging

Wireless Remote: IR Remote Sensor

 

How does it work?

  • Charge your storage mod up before the start of your day just as you would with your phone;
  • Dock the storage mod onto the back of your Moto Z like you would any other Moto Mod;
  • Select how you want The Storage Mod to keep your phone battery powered;
  • Forget the need for extra memory or battery while the Storage Mod is attached to your Moto Z smartphone;
  • Enjoy complete freedom to use your Moto Z  in desktop mode on the go !

Memory & Battery Mod for USB Type-C  and other Micro-USB Devices

 

The Impact

We commonly face many problems with our smartphones in our day to day life. One of them is the storage and inability to connect your portable hard drive to your phone for increased storage and battery backup of your smartphone to enhance productivity. The storage mod is one such solution to storage and battery problems.

It comes with many added benefits:--      

1) Built in internal storage beginning from 32GB which goes up to 256GB 

2) I/O ports which give us the freedom to use our phone as a portable computer 

3) Freedom to attach an USB drive to it 

4) Micro-USB and USB-A  port for data syncing and charging

5) The missing AUX port on the Moto Z

6) The freedom to attach SDXC card to the Mod to transfer or view images on the SD Card on your phone ;It is a great tool for photographers and video editors

7) It also comes equipped with a 2800 mAh battery which will ensure that your Moto Z is never out of juice

8) Wireless charging and IR capabilities.                                                               

The Storage Mod will add utility and convenience over and above what the phone is already capable of.  

 

Next Steps

I am working on a prototype, which is tested with its functionality for the intended purpose.  The electronic components have been tested with the phone and are working perfectly fine.  The housing for the same will be ready in a week’s time  and soon I will have a working proof-of-concept design that will work through the phone's USB port. Currently all of the components I have used are commercially available in the market. The development of a custom designed PCB is under progress and should be ready soon. After completion of the work of PCB designing it will  be directly tested on the MDK which will be the last stage of the prototyping. I need your help to take this prototype to Motorola and work with them to develop and test the final product ,as well as, get required certification and finalize the electronics.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by:--

  • Sharing this campaign with family and friends; to get us more and more  backers.

 

You can also read about us on :-

http://www.techdroider.com/2017/03/meet-storage...

You can watch the campaign video at our Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/storagemod/

story:
A closer look at the iPhone 7 model in misty white Python leather:

 
We base our proposition to you upon three key pillars...
 

ETHICAL & SUSTAINABLE ORIGINS 

We have exclusive agreements with tanneries in Tuscany to ensure that our entire premium leather collection is completely up-recycled. This means that our leather comes from the unused clippings of productions from other luxury European fashion houses, which would otherwise have gone to waste. This allows us to offer you the unique proposition that our premium leathers have a direct environmental impact of zero, other than that of shipping our goods. We also source our leather from CITES certified suppliers only, guaranteeing that these leathers were subject to the toughest international regulations on the protection of wildlife from illegal farming when first commissioned.

Here is a sample of the leathers on offer:

WORLD CLASS ITALIAN LEATHER

Our entire range of authentic bovine and exotic leathers are produced in Italy's prestigious tanning region of Tuscany, a trade which has been a vital part of local life for more than 2,000 years. The Exotic LeatherLuxury team regularly visits these Tuscan tanneries in person in order to hand-pick the very best leathers for our products. Our artisans then handcraft each piece to meet the highest possible standards of any premium leather product in the world. We are confident that this expertise makes us the prime Italian leather fashion house in London. 

Below are all of our iPhone model designs sporting Python, Lizard, Crocodile, Ostrich and Stingray leather, respectively. Maximum coverage of the leather is a central aspect of our aesthetic, without compromising robust protection of your device on the peripherals.

 

SMART DESIGN MEETS A UNIQUE AESTHETIC 

Traditional leathercrafting is beautiful as it is ancient, but we believe that what people really want is a tailoring of this tradition for the modern man and woman. Not only do we offer premium Italian produced leathers for your iPhone, we do so in harmony with providing robust protection for what is one of your most valuable everyday items.  This is because smart design is at the core of our creative process, and the end result is a range of cases which possess a unique fusion of classic Italian beauty and contemporary design.

WHAT NEXT?

Well, that's it! We've lovingly spent 9 unbroken working months to proudly present this finished product range to you today. We have the agreements with our Tuscan tanneries in place. We have our Italian-trained artisans on standby. We have our ultra-thin rubber frame designed in every iPhone model from the 5 to the 7 Plus, and every model in between. Now we need you to help us launch and change the way that people think about how to protect their iPhone.

No more mass produced plastic from China. No more faux or unethical luxury with an inflated price tag. This is the iPhone case made beautiful.

The Exotic LeatherLuxury team regularly visits these Tuscan tanneries in person in order to hand-pick the very best leathers for our products. Our artisans then handcraft each piece to meet the highest possible standards of any premium leather product in the world. We are confident that this expertise makes us the prime Italian leather fashion house in London. Below are all of our iPhone model designs sporting Python, Lizard, Crocodile, Ostrich and Stingray leather, respectively. Maximum coverage of the leather is a central aspect of our aesthetic, without compromising robust protection of your device on the peripherals. SMART DESIGN MEETS A UNIQUE AESTHETIC Traditional leathercrafting is beautiful as it is ancient, but we believe that what people really want is a tailoring of this tradition for the modern man and woman. Not only do we offer premium Italian produced leathers for your iPhone, we do so in harmony with providing robust protection for what is one of your most valuable everyday items.  This is because smart design is at the core of our creative process, and the end result is a range of cases which possess a unique fusion of classic Italian beauty and contemporary design.WHAT NEXT?Well, that's it! We've lovingly spent 9 unbroken working months to proudly present this finished product range to you today. We have the agreements with our Tuscan tanneries in place. We have our Italian-trained artisans on standby. We have our ultra-thin rubber frame designed in every iPhone model from the 5 to the 7 Plus, and every model in between. Now we need you to help us launch and change the way that people think about how to protect their iPhone.No more mass produced plastic from China. No more faux or unethical luxury with an inflated price tag. This is the iPhone case made beautiful.

story:
MoreToSee is the world’s first car phone holder and charger with a mounting base that has a unique spring-loaded gear specially designed for Tesla Model 3 and Model Y. Its adjustable hasp lock enables your device to be attached to different positions on the dashboard to the left of your steering wheel, perfect and ergonomic whether you are calling, navigating, listening to music, or charging. Its 360° pivot mount allows you to switch the phone to any angle and position. It securely holds your device in place while supporting Qi wireless charging up to 10W. MoreToSee is definitely the best accessory every Tesla Model 3 and Model Y owner should have.

This is the secret to why it can be mounted at any position on the dashboard. The mount plate is designed for fastening the bracket base on the i/p bezel, which ensures stability driving even on a bumpy road.

Superior to car mounts with suction cups or magnets, the mounting base of MoreToSee is stretchable so that you can install it anywhere that suits you. With the gear design, it can be stretched to any size that fits the instrument panel bezel. The gear mechanism is not only effort-saving but safer than normal stretchable holders because it returns gently.

The Swivel ball is featured to allow 360° rotation and set up your phone at different viewing angles.

The ergonomic design provides you a nice viewing position on the way. Unlike some car mounts, MoreToSee will never block your sight while you are driving, and it won’t be obstructed by the steering wheel.

MoreToSee built-in One-Touch layout to make one-hand operation comes true. Gently touch the trigger, it will release the clamp for putting your phone on it. The clamp will close by the gravity sensor.

The Qi wireless mount is compatible with a wide range of phones with a size between 4”~6.5” w/o a phone case. Meanwhile, the adjustable bottom tray also allows different models of phones to achieve wireless charging.

MoreToSee is able to tolerate the extreme temperature up to 70 ± 2°C (158 ± 4°F) and down to -10 ± 2°C (14 ± 4°F). No matter during summer or winter, it won’t cause any problems for its performance, especially the wireless charging.

With good consideration, MoreToSee is covered in a thick layer of silicone pad to protect your car from surface scratch. Say goodbye to the easy-scratched plastic panel car mount. The silicone material will ensure your mobile device is safe and stable when you are driving.

Slip-proof silicone mats are included on two clamps. It won’t be shaken off even doing the sharp turning or on the bumpy road. MoreToSee applies a standard USB-C connection for power, which also supplies power to your devices, achieving wireless charging. The adjustable bottom tray allows it to extend and fit any size of phone. The unblocked bottom design also allows users to charge phones with a charger.

story:
If you want to see what is hidden under the water surface area, you can either submerge… or you can construct a diving robot. 

Motorized and well equipped with a camera you can explore the hidden and mysterious underwater world of seas and oceans on your own.Diving robots internationally are known as ROV - (Remotely Operated Vehicle).

ROV-Control is the first modular control-system worldwide for homebuilt diving robots.

Theoretically there are no limits for size or shape if you want to construct a diving robot.

That is the reason why ROV-Control was invented as a modular system especially for homebuilt diving robots. You can use it for small diving robots as well as for complex diving systems.


How can you control it?


All you need is a laptop (with the ROV-Control software) and a joystick or a gamepad. Every movement is sent by the software via USB data-transmitter to the diving robot to control the engines. With ROV-Control you can manage the lights and other appliances. Furthermore you can display sensor data like temperature and depth.


X³-Control

The X³-Control is the mainboard of the ROV-Control solution. It is the centerpiece of the ROV. There are two different models:

*with vertical pinheaders

*with angled pinheaders

The mainboard is part of the diving robot. It is responsible for the steering of the motors and modules of the system. Two microcontrollers ensure a fast response to the control commands of the pilot and a high operating reliability.

Features of the X³-Control



It is possible to connect up to eight Electronic-Speed-Controller (ESC) to the X³-Control and trigger up to eight brushless-engines separatly.

*X³-Control with ESC and Brushless-Motor

Features:

  • Four LED-PWM channels for high-power-LEDs can be dimmed separately. A flashlight function makes it possible to use one channel as a position flashlight.
  • Four 2-way-switching-relays are implemented to connect different appliances. Each of them can handle consumers up to 1 Ah.
  • For measuring the depth it is possible to install different pressure sensors.
  • The GPS-sensor facilitates the marking and relocation of interesting diving areas.
  • In case of a cable break a bluetooth module supports a wireless-connection on surface (after auto-surface) and to navigate the diving robot controlled ashore.
  • The electrical power supply of the X³-Control works with two magnetic contacts. They are placed inside of the pressure hull and enable to switch the power of the X-Control contact-free with a magnet.
  • The X³-Control is made for lithium-polymer rechargeable batteries up to four cells. It runs with a supply voltage between 6,5 and 18 VDC. It is equipped with a reverse polarity and overload protection.
  • The temperature of both controllers is monitored by a digital sensor.
  • The automatic hardware-detection eases the configuration of additional modules and sensors. The X³-Control detects them automatically and displays them in the setup of the ROV-Control Software.
  • Status-LEDs for power and controller 1 and 2.
  • Firmware updates can be transferred automatically by a data interface.
  • The four-terminal Full Duplex-RS485 interface guarantees high transfer rates for cable lenghts up to 1000m (3000ft).

(Please read FAQ at bottom why wireless-connection is not possible)



Modules, sensors and extensions are connected to the X³-Control via one of the six I2C-ports.

Modules for the X³-Control

The following extensions can be connected to the X³-Control:


The camera

The most important part is the camera of course. It works as the „eye“ of the ROV. You can use every camera with a video output (yellow cinch/RCA). Cameras are not very expensive but to receive a good recording quality it is highly recommended to use a GoPro Hero HD (1,2,3) camera.
GoPro cameras have a high recording quality and a wide angle of up to 170 degrees. That`s why these cameras are predestinated for the usage in diving robots.

The CAM-CONTROL is a module in the same format as the X³-Control. With this module and the ROV-Control software it is possible to control two GoPro Hero HD (1,2,3) cameras at the same time.
The CAM-CONTROL is connected to the X³-Control and offers the following functions:

  • Controlling of MODE, SHUTTER* and WIFI*-button
  • Switchable power supply – no battery for camera is needed
  • Live-Out video at the GoPro Hero Bus


  • LIPO-CELL-MONITOR for the monitoring of four battery cell voltages.
  • Active powered I2C-HUB for other six I2C-modules
  • Eight channels for current or leakage sensors
  • Control-LED for POWER (I2C), CAM 1 and CAM 2
    *requires soldering

The video

The video signal is transmitted separately from the data. For each video signal you need two wires.

For the transmitting to the ROV a common network cable is recommended. It has eight wires, so you can use four wires for the data and the other four wires to transmit two different video signals to surface at the same time.

The USB-DATA-VIDEO offers a network socket to connect the X³-Control in a simple way by a network cable (up to 1000m/3000ft length) to a laptop.

The data interface is connected via USB and the video channels are conneted via two (Cinch) RCA sockets.


To display the video signal on the surface you can either use a monitor with a video input or it can be displayed via an USB-videograbber on the laptop screen.



The software

The new version of the ROV-Control software appears in a new design. It offers a wide range setup and a lot of new features.

Axes Mixer V2

In the innovative axes mixer V2 the motors are assigned to the control axes of the joystick or gamepad. There is a separate mixer setup for each control axis.
The direction of rotation and the power of the thruster can be configurated separately for each motor channel.
Because of the tuneable adjustment of the axes it is quite simple to put the diving robot in balance.

Sensors - 2nd compass

For a higher reliability operation it is possible to connect a second compass sensor to the second microcontroller. In case of the main compass fails it is still possible to navigate the diving robot safely ashore.

Sensors - Lipo-Cell-Monitor

The Lipo-Cell-Monitor assists with monitoring all of the cell voltages. The Lipo-Cell-Monitor is placed on the CAM-CONTROL and available as a stand-alone module.

Autopilot

To simplify the control the software is able to trim the diving robot in balance and to keep depth, course and position automatically. For this the individually configurable control axes are used.

Error-Mode

Cable broken? No problem at all!
If the connection to the diving robot fails it will surfaces self-dependent after the adjusted time has past.  
From the surface it is possible to get a data connection via bluetooth which enables to navigate the diving robot back to the shore. The X³-Control can also handle itself in a certain direction to go ashore automatically.
In the future the ROV will be able to reach GPS-positions itself

Overlay-Skin

With the Overlay-Skin data from the sensors and control functions can be displayed directly on the video stream. For this the video signal will be converted via USB-videograbber to the laptop and can be streamed on the software-background.

Touchscreen-Skin

In case of the video signal will be directly displayed on a monitor or a television screen (instead of displayed via videograbber on the laptop) it is recommended to use the Touchscreen-Skin. It is well optimized for touchscreen laptop or on an external touchscreen-monitor.

Summary of Features:

  • Supports two joysticks or controller
  • Measurement units adjustable (ft/m and °F or °C)
  • Multilanguage-Support
  • Hold of depth and position
  • Critical value for warning and error adjustable for each sensor
  • Autopilot
  • Error-Pilot with auto-surface function
  • Determination of GPS-positions
  • Record-timer for each camera
  • Mission-Logfile
  • Auto-functions
  • Configurable skins
  • Load and Save Configuration in User-Profiles
  • Functions for button, switch and two-way-switching
  • Flash-Function for position-LED
  • Auto-Update Firmware over Data-Connection
  • Special support for Saitek X52 Pro Flight-Controller (LED,MFD)
  • Webserver for live-video streaming
  • and many more...

ROV-Control Software requires Microsoft Windows 7 or higher.

Sensors

The following sensors can be connected to the X³-Control via I2C.

Compass

With the sensor for the compass you can determine the direction of the diving robot.


In case of an error an optional second compass sensor will be used for the auto-surface function of the Errorpilot.

Pitch and Roll

A gyro sensor for the position provides the values for roll and pitch. This sensor is also placed on the compass module.

Temperatur

It is possible to connect up to eight temperature sensors via I2C.

Depth

Pressure sensors with 4-20mA or 0-5V output can be directly connected to the X³-Control. There are also two digital pressure sensors (I2C) for 60 m and 140 m depth available.


Humidity

With the humidity sensor it is possible to measure humidity and temperature.


Modules

The following modules can be connected to X³-Control via I2C.

LED-BOARD

The LED-BOARD displays the current status of the X³-Control and the connected modules with eight colored LEDs. It can be put for example visible from the outside behind the front window of the ROV.


LIPO-CELL-MONITOR

Lithium-polymer batteries are very common for homemade robots. They are also suitable for usage in a ROV.

For the supply of the X³-Control a Lipo-battery-pack with four cells (14,8 V) is recommended. The cells can be damaged in case of undervoltage. That`s why they have to be monitored all the time.

The LIPO-CELL-MONITOR monitors the voltage of each cell. The software sends an alarm in case of the voltage is falling below a configured minimum. The module is directly connected to the balancer-connector of the LiPo battery. The LIPO-CELL-MONITOR is on the CAM-CONTROL as well and is connected to the X³-Control via I2C.


SENSOR-BOARD

Current or leakage sensors are connected to a SENSOR-BOARD. For an easy installation it is possible to place the plug connections in different directions.

Each SENSOR-BOARD has four channels for current or leakage sensors. A status-LED displays the electrical power supply. It is connected to the X³-Control via I2C.
Eight different adresses provide 32 sensor channels.




I2C-HUB

The I2C-HUB offers seven I2C ports. An optional voltage converter supplies the moduls and sensors which are connected.


VIDEO-SWITCH

The 4-channel VIDEO-SWITCH enables switching four camera signals on two outputs. It is also possible to use it in one-channel-mode




CONSTANT-CURRENT-SOURCES

For the usage of high-power-LEDs on the LED-channels of the X³-Control you will need a constant-current-source. It supplies the connected LEDs with permanent current.

For the X³-Control there are three different modules:


  1. The KSQ1000 can handle LEDs with 1000mA on one channel of the  X³-Control.
  2. The KSQ700-D can handle LEDs with 700mA on two channels.
  3. The KSQ1000-Q can handle LEDs with 1000 mA on all the four channels of the  X³-Control.

* 3x Cree XM-L T6 at KSQ1000

Depending on the supply voltage it is possible to run multiple LEDs on a constant-current-source at the same time.


Modules (prototypes)

These modules are still in a development. They will be available in May 2015:

MAIN-SWITCH (75A)

The MAIN-SWITCH turns on and off the main power circuit by using the X³-Control. It has a maximum continuous rate of 75 ampere.

POWER-SWITCH (8-CH)

For high-performance loads (for example ESC and thruster) – the POWER-SWITCH is the best solution. Eight channels can handle consumers up to 30 ampere. Four addresses supplies overall 32 switching channels.

CAM-CONTROL II

With the CAM CONTROL 2 you are able to control the 3rd and 4th (GoPro) camera in the ROV.


*CAM-CONTROL, X³-CONTROL, VIDEO-SWITCH



FAQ:

Why is a cable used?

A wireless communication is not possible under water. Water absorbs high frequencies very strong. To transmit a video signal frequencies are needed in the gigahertz range. Even the model building submarines can dive controlled by only a few feet - without video transmission.

How to use motors in the water?

Brushless-motors can be used in water without any changes. If you want to run it in saltwater, painting the coils will be necessary.

Why is there no all-in-one solution?

When you use diving robots it is not really practical to place all sensors on the main case because the sensor information can or shall not be recorded there. A pressure sensor on the control unit would not be very wise because it has to be placed in a pressure-tight case. Depending on the size and configuration of the system are parts housed in other cases. A modular system offers a free configuration and construction of all cases and modules at low cabling work.

Why no Ethernet is used for transmission of video and data?

An Ethernet limits the use of the camera systems only on webcams. But most cameras (like GoPro) have a “video-out” (yellow cinch/RCA). This signal cannot be send with data. However this video signal can be send by a cheap video-balun up to 300m(900ft) and with a second video signal by a common network-cable.

Why no embedded solution (Raspberry Pi) is used?

To wire the controller easily understandable provides the X³ control in a small space exactly those functions that are needed. An intricate lead out or tapping the pins is not necessary.
For diving robots the power consumption of components is very important. It decides during the battery operation on the period of use. An embedded system uses and provides the components with energy all the time, which have been assembled. A specially developed control unit does not require the hardware used in embedded systems, yet these (processor) power.

Is there a gripper arm solution?

A gripper arm is an extensive, mechanical and technical challenge. There is still no available grappler solution, which could be integrated.

Why is there no complete kit?

Constructing homemade diving robots is a growing trend. But there are rarely finished components. The crowdfunding of an american team has recently proved the substantial demand for thruster units, the T100 Thruster, which have been specially produced for the drive of watercrafts. Of course the X³ Control is compatible with the T100 and T200 thrusters.

* Source: Kickstarter.com

When I started self-construction of diving robots 7 years ago, there were only less people who tried it. The most people (like me) did not miss the creative ideas for the diving robots-drafts, but an easy to handle control solution. You were reliant on the most primitive media to realise the controlling, without any programmer skills and knowledge about microcontroller.
I do not offer a complete kit, because the liberty of the modular ROV-Control system shall encourage to new diving robots concepts and thruster configurations.
But I am sure there will be a larger charge of components and elements in the current age of the 3D-printers.

Where can i get help?

During the crowdfunding website www.rov-control.com is offline for updates.

There you will soon find more information about the construction of ROVs, a webshop with all modules and lots of accessories, as well as an English and a German-speaking forum. In the wiki all modules and their wiring are explained in English and German.

You are not up for the wet adventure?

ROV-Control is not only made for diving robots. You can also realise other types of robots with it…


Goal:

25.000 EUR - Full ROV-Control Solution
                            Production of the complete module series,
                            ROV-Control Software V3.1 Software

Streched goals:

35.000 EUR - Echo sounder module
                            The echo sounder is a very useful sensor when visibility conditions
                            are bad. It can detect objects below the ROV and displays the
                            “hight over ground”. It also can display the distance between objects
                            in front of the ROV. The autopilot can keep the “hight over ground”
                            automatically and prevent the ROV from getting damaged by
                            collisions.  Planned for July 2015.

45.000 EUR - Smartphone App - Bluetooth System
                             Use your Smartphone like a gamepad or control your ROV only with
                             your Tablet PC. Get a compact Bluetooth-control solution without
                             need of a PC or Laptop, just by your Smartphone or Tablet.

55.000 EUR - Zeiss Cinemizer 3D Headtracking, Planned Missions
                            Control your ROV with your Head by tracking your movement at Zeiss
                            Cinemizer 3D Video Glasses Headtracker. Control your ROV in
                            realistic 3D! Let your ROV cruise itself with planned waypoints and
                            actions.

75.000 EUR - Fiber Optic Solution
                            Get connected to your ROV via ONE cheap and lightweight
                         Fiber-optic network cable with Full HD video and HDMI output!


Timeline

Perks

ROV-CONTROL START set includes:
  • USB-DATA-VIDEO with adapter and usb cable
  • X³-CONTROL with magnet contacts, magnet, I2C cable (30cm/1ft) and 249Ohm Resistor (for pressure sensors with 4-20mA output)
  • LED-BOARD with I2C cable




ROV-CONTROL EXTENDED set includes:
  • ROV-CONTROL START set
  • compass module incl. gyro for roll/pitch (9dof) and I2C cable
  • temperature sensor (first address) and I2C cable

ROV-CONTROL CAM sets includes:
  • ROV-CONTROL EXTENDED set
  • CAM-CONTROL module with two 30pin connectors for GoPro Hero Bus and I2C cable

Risks & challenges

ROV-Control has given the proof in several diving robots that it works successful. From the beginning the upgrading to the full range of the module was well planned. The further development of the software was promoted in a professional way. Many of the modules are either already implemented in ROVER3D and in use or the prototypes still tested.

If new sources of error would be found the process of manufacture could be delayed and costs could increase. I know these kinds of “last-minute problems” very well and that`s the reason why I have calculated some buffers.

For the crowdfunding goals above 35.000 € it is not yet possible to determine the point of the start of the production run.

Who stands behind ROV-Control?

I am a 30 years old, well skilled IT systems technician and for more than seven years I am dealing with the construction of diving robots. I have developed a complete new design for diving robots and the first tests with ROVER II were very successful.
At the time when I started the construction there was no control solution at all. For that reason I tried from the beginning to develop an easy to use control system with a flexible structure and an extensive software to realize individual diving robots.

For a long time I was working on my own. In the meantime I work together with a very competent software engineer and expert for electronic issues. They are not named because they are not a part of this project.

Both of my diving robots are 100% hand-made. I have neither used a turning machine or a CNC-milling-machine. I have just jused tools which you can find in every domestic home. Everybody can copy it....you only have to find the way to your local tool store.
I really try to answer all the questions concerning the details.
The new ROV-CONTROL website will be online soon with multi-language forum and more support and instruction manuals.

Andreas Knabbe

The data interface is connected via USB and the video channels are conneted via two (Cinch) RCA sockets.To display the video signal on the surface you can either use a monitor with a video input or it can be displayed via an USB-videograbber on the laptop screen.
The software


The new version of the ROV-Control software appears in a new design. It offers a wide range setup and a lot of new features.Axes Mixer V2
In the innovative axes mixer V2 the motors are assigned to the control axes of the joystick or gamepad. There is a separate mixer setup for each control axis.The direction of rotation and the power of the thruster can be configurated separately for each motor channel.Because of the tuneable adjustment of the axes it is quite simple to put the diving robot in balance.

Sensors - 2nd compass
For a higher reliability operation it is possible to connect a second compass sensor to the second microcontroller. In case of the main compass fails it is still possible to navigate the diving robot safely ashore.

Sensors - Lipo-Cell-Monitor



 The Lipo-Cell-Monitor assists with monitoring all of the cell voltages. The Lipo-Cell-Monitor is placed on the CAM-CONTROL and available as a stand-alone module.

Autopilot
To simplify the control the software is able to trim the diving robot in balance and to keep depth, course and position automatically. For this the individually configurable control axes are used.

Error-Mode
Cable broken? No problem at all!If the connection to the diving robot fails it will surfaces self-dependent after the adjusted time has past.  From the surface it is possible to get a data connection via bluetooth which enables to navigate the diving robot back to the shore.  The X³-Control can also handle itself in a certain direction to go ashore automatically.In the future the ROV will be able to reach GPS-positions itself

Overlay-Skin


With the Overlay-Skin data from the sensors and control functions can be displayed directly on the video stream. For this the video signal will be converted via USB-videograbber to the laptop and can be streamed on the software-background.
Touchscreen-Skin


In case of the video signal will be directly displayed on a monitor or a television screen (instead of displayed via videograbber on the laptop) it is recommended to use the Touchscreen-Skin. It is well optimized for touchscreen laptop or on an external touchscreen-monitor.
Summary of Features:

Supports two joysticks or controller

Measurement units adjustable (ft/m and °F or °C)

Multilanguage-Support
Hold of depth and position

Critical value for warning and error adjustable for each sensor

Autopilot

Error-Pilot with auto-surface function

Determination of GPS-positions
Record-timer for each camera

Mission-Logfile
Auto-functions
Configurable skins

Load and Save Configuration in User-Profiles
Functions for button, switch and two-way-switching

Flash-Function for position-LED

Auto-Update Firmware over Data-Connection

Special support for Saitek X52 Pro Flight-Controller (LED,MFD)

Webserver for live-video streaming
and many more...


ROV-Control Software requires Microsoft Windows 7 or higher.


Sensors

The
following sensors can be connected to the X³-Control via I2C.
Compass
With the sensor for the compass you can determine the direction of the
diving robot. 

In
case of an error an optional second compass sensor will be used for the auto-surface function of the Errorpilot.Pitch and Roll
A gyro sensor for the position provides the
values for roll and pitch. This
sensor is also placed on the compass module.
Temperatur

It
is possible to connect up to eight temperature sensors via I2C.

Depth

Pressure
sensors with 4-20mA or 0-5V output can be directly connected to the X³-Control.
There are also two digital pressure sensors (I2C) for 60 m and 140 m depth
available.
Humidity

With
the humidity sensor it is possible to measure humidity and temperature. 
Modules

The
following modules can be connected to X³-Control via I2C.

LED-BOARD

The
LED-BOARD displays the current status of the X³-Control and the
connected modules with eight colored LEDs. It can be put for example visible
from the outside behind the front window of the ROV.
LIPO-CELL-MONITOR
Lithium-polymer batteries are very common for homemade robots. They are also
suitable for usage in a ROV.
For the supply of the
X³-Control a Lipo-battery-pack with four cells (14,8 V) is
recommended. The cells can be damaged in case of undervoltage. That`s why they
have to be monitored all the time. 
The LIPO-CELL-MONITOR monitors the voltage of each cell. The software sends an alarm in case of the
voltage is falling below a configured minimum. The module is directly connected to the
balancer-connector of the LiPo battery. The LIPO-CELL-MONITOR is on the CAM-CONTROL
as well and is connected to the X³-Control via I2C.
SENSOR-BOARD

Current or leakage sensors are connected
to a SENSOR-BOARD. For an easy installation it is possible to place the plug
connections in different directions.


Each SENSOR-BOARD has four channels for current or leakage sensors. A
status-LED displays the electrical power supply. It is connected to the
X³-Control via I2C.Eight
different adresses provide 32 sensor channels.
I2C-HUB
The I2C-HUB offers seven I2C ports. An optional voltage converter supplies the moduls and sensors which are
connected.


VIDEO-SWITCH
The
4-channel VIDEO-SWITCH enables switching four camera signals on two outputs. It
is also possible to use it in one-channel-mode



CONSTANT-CURRENT-SOURCES

For
the usage of high-power-LEDs on the LED-channels of the X³-Control you will
need a constant-current-source. It supplies the connected LEDs with permanent
current.
For
the X³-Control there are three different modules:


The KSQ1000 can handle LEDs with 1000mA on one channel of the  X³-Control.
The KSQ700-D can handle LEDs with 700mA on two channels.
The KSQ1000-Q can handle LEDs with 1000 mA on all the four channels of the  X³-Control.



* 3x Cree XM-L T6 at KSQ1000Depending
on the supply voltage it is possible to run multiple LEDs on a
constant-current-source at the same time.

Modules (prototypes)

These
modules are still in a development. They will be available in May 2015:MAIN-SWITCH (75A)

The MAIN-SWITCH turns on and off the main power circuit by using the X³-Control. It
has a maximum continuous rate of 75 ampere.
POWER-SWITCH (8-CH)

For high-performance loads (for example ESC and thruster) – the POWER-SWITCH is the best solution. Eight channels can handle consumers up to 30
ampere. Four addresses supplies overall
32 switching channels.
CAM-CONTROL II

With the CAM CONTROL 2 you are able to control the 3rd and 4th (GoPro) camera in the ROV.*CAM-CONTROL, X³-CONTROL, VIDEO-SWITCH
FAQ:

Why is a cable used?
A wireless communication is not possible under water. Water absorbs high frequencies very strong. To transmit a video signal frequencies are needed in the gigahertz range. Even the model building submarines can dive controlled by only a few feet - without video transmission.How to use motors in the water?Brushless-motors can be used in water without any changes. If you want to run it in saltwater, painting the coils will be necessary.
Why is there no all-in-one solution?
When
you use diving robots it is not really practical to place all sensors on the
main case because the sensor information can or shall not be recorded there. A
pressure sensor on the control unit would not be very wise because it has
to be placed in a pressure-tight case. Depending on the size and configuration of the system are parts housed in other cases. A modular system offers a free
configuration and construction of all cases and modules at low cabling work.Why no Ethernet is used for transmission of video and data?
An Ethernet limits the use of the camera systems only on webcams. But most cameras (like GoPro) have a “video-out” (yellow cinch/RCA). This signal cannot be send with data. However this video signal can be send by a cheap video-balun up to 300m(900ft) and with a second video signal by a common network-cable.Why no embedded solution (Raspberry Pi) is used?To wire the controller easily understandable provides the X³ control in a small space exactly those functions that are needed. An intricate lead out or tapping the pins is not necessary.For diving robots the power consumption of components is very important. It decides during the battery operation on the period of use. An embedded system uses and provides the components with energy all the time, which have been assembled. A specially developed control unit does not require the hardware used in embedded systems, yet these (processor) power.
Is there a gripper arm solution?
A gripper arm
is an extensive, mechanical and technical challenge. There is still no
available grappler solution, which could be integrated.Why is there no complete kit?
Constructing homemade diving robots is a growing trend. But there are rarely finished components. The crowdfunding of an american team has recently proved the substantial demand for thruster units, the T100 Thruster, which have been specially produced for the drive of watercrafts. Of course the X³ Control is compatible with the T100 and T200 thrusters.

* Source: Kickstarter.com
When I started self-construction of diving robots 7 years ago, there were only less people who tried it. The most people (like me) did not miss the creative ideas for the diving robots-drafts, but an easy to handle control solution. You were reliant on the most primitive media to realise the controlling, without any programmer skills and knowledge about microcontroller.I do not offer a complete kit, because the liberty of the modular ROV-Control system shall encourage to new diving robots concepts and thruster configurations.But I am sure there will be a larger charge of components and elements in the current age of the 3D-printers.Where can i get help?During the crowdfunding website www.rov-control.com is offline for updates. There you will  soon find more information about the construction of ROVs, a webshop with all modules and lots of accessories, as well as an English and a German-speaking forum. In the wiki all modules and their wiring are explained in English and German.

You are not up for the wet adventure?

ROV-Control is not only made for diving
robots. You can also realise other types of robots with it…

Goal:
25.000 EUR - Full ROV-Control Solution                            Production of the complete module series,                            ROV-Control Software V3.1 SoftwareStreched goals:35.000 EUR - Echo sounder module                            The echo sounder is a very useful sensor when visibility conditions                            are bad. It can detect objects below the ROV and displays the                            “hight over ground”. It also can display the distance between objects                            in front of the ROV. The autopilot can keep the “hight over ground”                            automatically and prevent the ROV from getting damaged by                            collisions.  Planned for July 2015.45.000 EUR - Smartphone App - Bluetooth System                             Use your Smartphone like a gamepad or control your ROV only with                             your Tablet PC. Get a compact Bluetooth-control solution without                             need of a PC or Laptop, just by your Smartphone or Tablet.55.000 EUR - Zeiss Cinemizer 3D Headtracking, Planned Missions                             Control your ROV with your Head by tracking your movement at Zeiss                            Cinemizer 3D Video Glasses Headtracker. Control your ROV in                            realistic 3D! Let your ROV cruise itself with planned waypoints and                            actions.75.000 EUR - Fiber Optic Solution                            Get connected to your ROV via ONE cheap and lightweight                         Fiber-optic network cable with Full HD video and HDMI output!
TimelinePerks
ROV-CONTROL START set includes:
USB-DATA-VIDEO with adapter and usb cable
X³-CONTROL with magnet contacts, magnet, I2C cable (30cm/1ft) and 249Ohm Resistor (for pressure sensors with 4-20mA output)
LED-BOARD with I2C cable
ROV-CONTROL EXTENDED set includes:
ROV-CONTROL START set
compass module incl. gyro for roll/pitch (9dof) and I2C cable

temperature sensor (first address) and I2C cable

ROV-CONTROL CAM sets includes:
ROV-CONTROL EXTENDED set

CAM-CONTROL module with two 30pin connectors for GoPro Hero Bus and I2C cable

Risks & challenges
ROV-Control has given the proof in several diving robots that it works successful. From the beginning the upgrading to the full range of the module was well planned. The further development of the software was promoted in a professional way. Many of the modules are either already implemented in ROVER3D and in use or the prototypes still tested.If new sources of error would be found the process of manufacture could be delayed and costs could increase. I know these kinds of “last-minute problems” very well and that`s the reason why I have calculated some buffers.For the crowdfunding goals above 35.000 € it is not yet possible to determine the point of the start of the production run.

Who stands behind ROV-Control?
I am a 30 years old, well skilled IT systems technician and for more than seven years I am dealing with the construction of diving robots. I have developed a complete new design for diving robots and the first tests with ROVER II were very successful.At the time when I started the construction there was no control solution at all. For that reason I tried from the beginning to develop an easy to use control system with a flexible structure and an extensive software to realize individual diving robots.For a long time I was working on my own. In the meantime I work together with a very competent software engineer and expert for electronic issues. They are not named because they are not a part of this project.Both of my diving robots are 100% hand-made. I have neither used a turning machine or a CNC-milling-machine. I have just jused tools which you can find in every domestic home. Everybody can copy it....you only have to find the way to your local tool store.I really try to answer all the questions concerning the details.The new ROV-CONTROL website will be online soon with multi-language forum and more support and instruction manuals.Andreas Knabbe

story:
CLICK HERE to learn about our Thank You Rewards Program!




Engineered to sound better than any conventional Bluetooth speaker and designed to free your smartphone while streaming your favorite Music, Movies and Apps. With integrated WiFi and built in memory, no other devices are needed.


From the kitchen to the bedroom, the backyard to the beach, the all-in-one auris zwing is the only solution you'll need to bring entertainment everywhere.





Unlike most wireless speakers, zwing can stream uninterrupted music, TV shows, movies, audio books and more, all without a source device.



Smartly designed and carefully tuned audio delivers high fidelity sound that’s far beyond what you can get from conventional portable Bluetooth speakers.


A revolutionary standalone portable speaker that features an Android platform designed with performance and convenience lets you bring your media anywhere.











zwing will play nearly any app without relying on your smartphone, bringing a smarter way to instantly enjoy.

Built in 802.11 b/g/n WiFi connects to a smart Android platform for uninterrupted streaming from popular apps like Spotify, Pandora, Netflix, Youtube and more. 

It’s all easily navigated using an intuitive 7 inch touchscreen interface. Everything you love is now at your fingertips.



Equipped with Bluetooth® 4.0 technology to connect wirelessly.

Bluetooth® 4.0 is further enhanced with high quality aptX® audio coding that lets you stream wirelessly with almost loss-less audio quality at greater distances.

Integrated WiFi connectivity, enables you to stream music from your iPhone, iPad, iPod Touch or iTunes (Mac or PC) with AirPlay® technology, all in blistering high-quality lossless audio.

zwing also uses NFC, meaning you can instantly sync zwing with any NFC enabled phone.



With the zwing you’ll never have to worry about running low on space.

It features an on-board memory of 8GB or 32GB, while a Micro SD card slot expands your storage by up to 128GB. Includes a Micro USB slot for easy transfer of your content from other sources, and 3.5mm stereo input for direct connections.



We used to only listen to music stored on CDs, MP3 players, USB Drives, etc. Now we've moved to the cloud through various Apps like Spotify or YouTube.

The power and intelligence of its full-fledged Android KitKat OS experience gives you access to more than just the most popular music apps, but also movies, games, TV shows and more through the Google Play Store.






Designed using leading edge technologies to create the powerful sound that will elevate your sound experience.

Conveniently compact and portable, yet carefully tuned to produce powerful, wide & immersive HiFi sound when you need it. Anywhere! The custom built drivers are engineered to deliver outstanding low frequency response, sharp mids, smooth highs, and rumbling deep dynamic bass.



zwing is much louder than your average portable Bluetooth speaker. The strongly built custom woofers retain its shape even when being driven at high levels. The silk tweeters hold up well under high power and the edge-driven design gives very smooth response.


Time-aligned 2-way system, precision custom neodymium loudspeakers, tuned bass-reflex, silk dome tweeters and DSP processing, zwing offers an ultra-accurate frequency response, exceptional bass response and stereo imaging.



Each woofer is perfectly aligned with precisely tuned back-firing bass pipes to deliver truly impressive and tight bass performance from such a compact speaker.


A smooth flow of air reduces unwanted noise and the result - exceptional realism and immersive listening experience.



The acoustic volume allocated to each midrange driver perfectly matches its acoustic requirements.



It’s carefully tuned audio reaches volumes up to 115 db. Low tones come out deep and tight – delivering strong and rich bass.






Stream nearly anything, anywhere. Android gives you access to thousands of Apps in the Google Store with its intuitive touchscreen and streamlined interface.

The power and intelligence of its full-fledged Android KitKat OS experience gives you access to more than just the most popular music apps, but also movies, games, TV shows and more through the Google Play Store.



Forget about power points and plug sockets – Just pick it up and play anywhere. It also features a built-in USB port to charge your smartphone when low on battery.

A powerful 12V / 5000mAh rechargeable lithium polymer battery keeps the zwing going for 20 solid hours of playback. That’s more than enough time for a picnic in the park or to keep the party going all night long.



Comes complete with a 5MP front facing AF camera and built-in microphone with echo-cancellation.

Invite others to watch from afar over Skype, Google Hangout or your favorite App. From live streaming your childs birthday party for relatives to capturing all the action on the local memory, zwing is sure to capture memories.



HDMI output with Full HD support opens up the opportunity to put the power of Android to any TV, Monitor or Projector.

This makes any of these devices to instantly become a Smart TV enabling seamless video streaming either from zwing’s on board storage or from Netflix, Hulu Plus, Youtube and many more!









Designed with performance and convenience in mind. 

Weighing approx. 5.3 lbs, its light and portable enough to take anywhere from the office to the kitchen or from the beach to the backyard BBQ.





We hope to be done a lot sooner... We are estimating worse case scenarios below! 




Q. How do I choose my color / shipping address?

A. We’ll send you an email with a link to our backer management website after the campaign closes. The system will collect your shipping address and your preferred color.

Q. When will I receive my zwing?

A. We plan to start shipping zwing by October 2015.

Q. Where do you ship?

A. We plan to ship to all countries. We plan to use major courier companies and we will ship to anywhere that they deliver.

Q. How much is shipping?

A. Shipping is free within the US. International orders will require an additional contribution for shipping on top of the amount paid for the Perk (please see the details listed in each of the Perks). Backers are responsible for any VAT or customs duties levied by their own countries.

Q. Is there a warranty for zwing?

A. Yes, zwing comes with a 1-year warranty.

Q. What kind of device do I need to stream music wirelessly to zwing?

A. Any device that has Bluetooth, including your smart phone, tablet, laptop or PC.

Q. Does it have an internal battery?

A. Yes, zwing has a built-in battery that recharges when plugged in.

Q. How long does the battery last?

A. Up to 20 hours of listening to music stored internally.

Up to 15 hours of listening to music streamed from apps like Pandora, Spotify, etc. or Bluetooth.  

Up to 8 hours of continuous Video playback.

Q. What is the USB port for?

A. It charges your phone or tablet. Just plug your device via its USB charger and zwing will charge it, even when it is running off its own battery.

Q. I have more questions. Who can I ask?

A. Please email us at support@theauris.com and we will reply as soon as possible.

story:
Meet 


The Tech That Gets Kids Active Again...



  1. The 'Brillar' is a GSM & GPS connected wearable device and an exciting new concept in keeping your child happy, active and safe
  2. Powered by our real world gaming app Roodymentary, the Brillar device connects your child with their virtual playmate Roody
  3. Managed by parents through the app, Roody calls the children with a rudimental yet fun, real-time, real-world world Activity
  4. The children are rewarded and encouraged digitally as they achieve their goals
  5. The Brillar can also be used to make and receive calls to three numbers of your choosing

  6. The Brillar is fitted with a MTK GPS chipset that's constantly connected to our platform and our cellular network  transmitting its current & historical positioning

What problem are we solving for you?

Using smart technology to get families active and collaborating together again whilst balancing screen / sedentary play with real world play.

Most of today's technology is either geared towards adults or children, but there are few experiences and devices that are built for joint experiences or for combining technology experiences with real-world play.
  • The Brillar is an independent device and is not tethered or Bluetooth connected, having its own integrated SIM and mobile connection
  • It's the ultimate kids' wearable with gaming, learning, GPS tracking and auto alert notifications added to its two way calling functionality, for that added peace of mind
  • Interactive voice platform using smart algorithm that learns and tailors the suggested ‘Activities’ to your child
  • Brillar + Roodymentary = happy, active and secure children
  • We have designed it to keep families connected, and children active, social and safe
  • It gives you and your family the best of the real and digital worlds





Why BRILLAR?

A recent study by the UK organisation Childwise found on average today's children spend six hours a day inactive in front of screens, and just six minutes outdoors.

As parents, we often feel guilty about using screen-based technology to babysit children. It keeps them occupied, but unfortunately also keeps them inactive.

Brillar harnesses the same technology which children find so spellbinding, and turns it into something that exercises more than just their thumbs...getting them up and active!

Brillar is the only wearable children's device you'll need. It gets kids active, keeps them social and entertained, and gives them superb levels of protection. Use it to Call, Entertain, Educate & Locate...All bases covered? We certainly think so.


BRILLAR Functions



How It Works

Parents set an activity challenge via Roodymentary app. Roody HQ calls the child directly on their device with the task...Pretty cool, huh..?



As they complete their tasks, they are rewarded with stickers...


Then badges and special costumes to dress Roody up with


The best bit, they get to show off and congratulate friends with our peer recognition feature





Unlike Any Other Kids' GPS Tracking Service  - The Roody Factor

The incentive is named Roody – the hero of our app Roodymentary. Children can design their own ‘Roody’ character – Roody (our platform), at a time of your choosing makes a personalised one-way (not a two way converstion) call to the child on their Brillar device, giving them a rudimental but stimulating challenge of your choosing. It could be cooking, spelling or a treasure hunt. Once completed and approved by you, they then get to share that success with their pals for that all important peer recognition. It can also be used to convert any message you want into a voice message from Roody. 

Think Charlie's Angels meets Club Penguin, but with parents taking an active, collaborative role. Roodymentary is about the gamification of real-world activities to stimulate a child, encouraging learning and engagement with friends and parents. 

Please note you will need a Brillar device to experience the service in full.

The interactive nature of the app is cleverly designed to combine sedentary screen play with physical activity. It is available on iOS and Android.  Getting them to clean their room, has never been so easy! 



Together Roodymentary and Brillar are a perfect package with many benefits. To meet Roody and find out more, visit our site.



BRILLAR is Almost Ready…

Over the past 18 months our company has been developing, validating and refining Brillar so that it enhances the Roodymentary experience and provides you with other important value-added services, such as GPS tracking, geo-fencing and two-way calling.

With your help we will finish off the final hardware development along with the firmware and the software development of the app to incorporate tracking APIs  into the Roodymentary platform. We can then jump-start our initial production run of 1,000 units.

We need you to take this from prototype to production; we can bring Brillar to homes and families around the world and get kids up, active and inspired with your help and support.

Your contribution will allow us to:

  • Finish off the Brillar Tooling
  • Move from prototype to production
  • Finish off the tracking platform and integrate into Roodymentary stack
  • Finish off APIs and integrate Roody call set-up into the Roodymentary stack
  • Jump-start the initial production run of the exclusive Indiegogo 'yellow' Brillar

The more we raise, the more we can do.


How to Order

  1. Choose a perk and pledge. We would recommend The $100 Brillar Perk which gives you a great discount on the RRP of $129.99, but any contribution, not matter how small will make a difference and gets us closer to our goal.
  2. If you are not a member of Indiegogo, you will need to join. Once logged in and chosen your Perk or contribution value, follow the online instructions.  
  3. Shipping of the BRILLAR will commence last week in March 2016. Pat yourself on the back and sit tight while we take care of the rest.


Perks and What You Get

Any Perk purchased, brings us one step closer to our goal. For a fuller description of each perk, please check the Perks section of this page (top right).








BRILLAR Specification 




Delivery Schedule


WE WELCOME FEEDBACK - ANY QUESTIONS PLEASE MESSAGE US THROUGH THIS CHANNEL or at contact@gloglu.com


FAQ's

I don’t understand Crowdfunding - am I invetsing in your company?

No, you are either making a donation or buying a PERK (product) in advance at a discounted price. It really doesn’t matter how small or big you contribution is - every bit makes a difference. It helps with our cash-flow and allows us to get the product out there as cheaply and as effeicently as possible. You get the product before anyone else and the warm feeling of helping us up…

How much does the Brillar cost?

There are different costs for Brillar depending on your level of support.

To say thank you for your early support, the Indiegogo Early Bird special means you will pay no more than US$100 for your Brillar device. If you buy our Quattro Brillante Perk, you'll be getting them for US$90 each, plus a month's free subscription. 

At general launch the Brillar will have a RRP of US$129.99. Included in the box is a 'glo in the dark' Micro USB charger and plug point. Thereafter, there’s a monthly fee of US$10 (or local equivalent) to cover access to 30 Free Activities a month, unlimited GPS tracking, 100 minutes of calls from your child’s Brillar device; and unlimited Geo fencing and Alerts. You will not pay the first month's fee until after you have received the device and activated your Brillar account. This fee is for premium access to the games, alerts, tracking and voice usage. Any SIM device needs to have some sort of connection to work and thus associated cost. We have not bundeld this service cost into the purchase price, to remain as transparent as possible. 

We will also be giving one Brillar away a day! Each day we'll sell one for just $1 on a first-come-first-serve basis.

For further details, please visit www.gloglu.com.  However, please see our Perks page for the Indiegogo special.

Why are the Perks priced in dollars?

We only have one currency choice and as Indiegogo is based in the United States, it's simpler to keep it in US$. Any payment you make will be converted from your local currency and paid in US$ to Indiegogo, keeping it as efficient and simple as possible.

Where will the BRILLAR SIM work?

The Brillar and its associated SIM card will work in the USA, Canada, Mexico, Europe & the UK, along with Algeria, American Samoa, Angola, Anguilla, Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Armenia, Aruba, Australia, Azerbaijan, Bahamas, Bahrain, Bangladesh, Barbados, Belize, Benin, Bermuda, Bhutan, Botswana, Brazil, British Virgin Islands, Brunei Darussalam, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Cape Verde, Cayman Islands, Central African Republic, Chad, Chile, China, Colombia, Comoros, Congo, Cook Islands, Costa Rica, Cote D'Ivoire, Cuba, Cyprus, Democratic People's Republic of Korea, Djibouti, Dominica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, Egypt, El Salvador, Equatorial Guinea, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Falkland Islands, Faroe Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Fiji, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Gambia, Ghana, Gibraltar, Greenland, Grenada, Guam, Guatemala, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, Guyana, Haiti, Honduras, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Iraq, Islamic Republic of Iran, Jamaica, Japan, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kenya, Kiribati, Kuwait, Kyrgyzstan, Lao People's Democratic Republic, Lebanon, Lesotho, Liberia, Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, Macao, Madagascar, Malawi, Malaysia, Maldives, Mali, Marshall Islands, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mexico, Mongolia, Montenegro, Montserrat, Morocco, Mozambique, Myanmar, Namibia, Nauru, Nepal, New Caledonia, New Zealand, Nicaragua, Niger, Nigeria, Northern Mariana Islands, Oman, Pakistan, Palau, Panama, Papua New Guinea, Paraguay, Peru, Philippines, Plurinational State of Bolivia, Puerto Rico, Qatar, Republic of Korea, Republic of Moldova, Reunion, Russian Federation, Rwanda, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Saint Lucia, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Samoa, Sao Tome and Principe, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Serbia, Seychelles, Sierra Leone, Singapore, Solomon Islands, Somalia, South Africa, Sri Lanka, The Democratic Republic of the Congo, The Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia and Timor-Leste. Please see our website www.gloglu.com for up to date charges at time of delivery. Please note all calls from Roody will be in English only.

How long am I tied into the service for & what do we get?

We use a 30-day rolling agreement, so you can choose to leave at any time, with no charge incurred. 

Can we use the Brillar with our own or a different SIM card?

Yes, you can and do not have to sign up to our rolling agreement or use our SIM card. The device will work with any Micro SIM card and can be used to recieve regular phone calls only - but you will not be able to generate calls from the device or benefit from all of the Roodymentary value added features, such as the 30 free Activities a month with personalised calls from Roody, GPS tracking, geo-fencing or alerts.

Can I change our monthly subscription?

At the moment we only have one price point, and we are working hard to have a few choices added as soon as possible.

How is my child’s BRILLAR device able to communicate with my telephone?

The Brillar device communicates using GSM technology – the same system used by your mobile phone. In Europe it will be assigned with a UK number and in the Americas it will be assigned a US one.

Can my child call any telephone number using their Brillar device?

Your child is limited to calling one of the three pre-set numbers chosen by you. But these can be changed at any time by you through your account settings on the app.

Can anyone ring my child’s BRILLAR?

Only the numbers specifically chosen by you can contact the device.

Can my child send or receive text messages using the BRILLAR device?

The only communication functionality is the calling setting – your child is limited to calling one of the three pre-set numbers chosen by you. They cannot connect to the internet. Nor can they access the internet.

How many calls can my child make in a month?

Your child can make up to 100 minutes of calls per month. If those minutes are used up, we will charge per minute. They will also get 30 free Activity calls a month from Roody HQ!

Can my child use their device to make emergency calls?

In case of emergency your child can call one of the three permitted numbers.

How accurate is the BRILLAR GPS tracking system?

It is very accurate! Brillar’s GPS system has an ‘up-time’ of 99.99% – i.e. it’s fully operational 99.99% of the time. Your child’s Brillar device is set to ‘poll’ – i.e. take note of your child’s location – every 10 minutes. You can, however, adjust the service to poll either less or more frequently. Please note the shorter the interval, the bigger the drain on the battery.

Will data collected on my child be secure?

Yes. All collected data – including GPS location data – is held on our secure, UK-based servers, and is never shared with anyone.

Is Roodymentary a social networking site for children?

Roodymentary is not a social networking site for children. With the permission of both sets of parents/guardians, children who are friends can view each other’s profiles to see which Activities and Playsets they have completed. They can then show approval of these achievements with a digital Thumbs-Up – and that is the full extent of the interaction possible. There are no ‘status update’ or ‘instant message’ facilities.

Will I be able to use my existing Roodymentary app when we get the BRILLAR?

You need to download a new version, called Roodymentary+. Please keep an eye on www.gloglu.com for up-to-date instructions.

Is the BRILLAR waterproof?

It is water resistant. This means some splashing will be fine, but it should not be submerged in water. Please refer to your box and leaflet when you first set up.

Is the BRILLAR device designed by Glo Glu?

Yes, it has been designed by the Glo Glu team in London, and it will be assembled in Shenzhen, China. We have spent a significant amount of time designing and developing the device to ensure comfort, performance and durability.

If We Beat Our Target We Can:

  • Add Bluetooth to Brillar
  • Add NFC to Brillar
  • Add pedometer to Brillar
  • Make Brillar 3G compatible
  • Add heat mapping
  • Develop new games in time for shipping Brillar
  • Develop a set of secret levels to be unlocked on achievement
  • Add location-based gaming
  • Develop a more sophisticated UI within the Roodymentary gaming experience
  • Produce the Brillar in a range of colours
  • Localise the service and have Roody in different languages, such as Spanish, Mandarin & Arabic

Impact

Any help will have a significant impact on our campaign. It doesn't matter if you buy a perk or send an email referring us on to someone else. It's as simple as this – the more people who know about our campaign, the greater our chance of making this a success for all.

Risks

As with any technology project, the best-laid plans can sometimes go wrong. With tech projects especially, deadlines can get missed due to the number of other stakeholders involved. We see the biggest threats to our schedule a:

  • Tooling
  • Integration of tracking APIs into current Roodymentary app stack, and the hardware, firmware and software working as set out in the business requirements
  • Back-end bug fixing
  • Supply chain issues
  • Unknown unknowns

Other Ways to Help

We are working with some really exciting partners and are actively looking at open-source collaboration, so please get in touch if you are keen to join the programme.

Don't worry if you are not in a position to buy a perk right now, please just send on our campaign (with the easy-to-use Indiegogo share tools) and become one of our advocates – it should help kids kick their screen dependency.

Please don't forget:

  1. It doesn't cost to refer (use the Indiegogo share tools)
  2. With our 'Refer Are Us' Perk, the first to refer US$5,000 in perks will get a free Brillar and a subscription for life
  3. With 'Bongo Brillar' you can get the Brillar for just US$1. There will be a new opportunity every day of the campaign.

Together we can get the kids up, active and balance their screen time... a win-win, or, as we say, the Best of Both Worlds.

And that's all there is to it. We know the hard work starts now. What are you waiting for... an invite from President Obama?

'We've been trying to initiate ways to get more children and young people to use the parks. And, as you said, so many of these kids are growing up cut off. They're sitting on the couch, they're playing video games; if they experience nature, it's through a television screen and just getting them out there so that they're picking up that rock and finding that slug, they're seeing that bird with colours that they haven't seen before.'

THANK YOU!
story_txt:
Meet 


The Tech That Gets Kids Active Again...


The 'Brillar' is a GSM & GPS connected wearable device and an exciting new concept in keeping your child happy, active and safe
Powered by our real world gaming app Roodymentary, the Brillar device connects your child with their virtual playmate Roody
Managed by parents through the app, Roody calls the children with a rudimental yet fun, real-time, real-world world Activity
The children are rewarded and encouraged digitally as they achieve their goals
The Brillar can also be used to make and receive calls to three numbers of your choosing
The
Brillar is fitted with a MTK GPS chipset that's constantly connected
to our platform and our cellular network  transmitting its current &
historical positioning
What problem are we solving for you?Using smart technology to get families active and collaborating together again whilst balancing screen / sedentary play with real world play.Most of today's technology is either geared towards adults or children, but there are few experiences and devices that are built for joint experiences or for combining technology experiences with real-world play.

The Brillar is an independent device and is not tethered or Bluetooth connected, having its own integrated SIM and mobile connection
It's the ultimate kids' wearable with gaming, learning, GPS tracking and auto alert notifications added to its two way calling functionality, for that added peace of mind
Interactive voice platform using smart algorithm
     that learns and tailors the suggested ‘Activities’ to your child
Brillar + Roodymentary = happy, active and secure children
We have designed it to keep families connected, and children active, social and safe
It gives you and your family the best of the real and digital worlds






Why BRILLAR?
A recent study by the UK organisation Childwise found on average today's children spend six hours a day inactive in front of screens, and just six minutes outdoors.
As
parents, we often feel guilty about using screen-based technology to babysit
children. It keeps them occupied, but unfortunately also keeps them inactive.
Brillar
 harnesses the same technology which children find so spellbinding, and
turns it into something that exercises more than just their thumbs...getting them
up and active!Brillar is the only wearable children's device you'll need. It gets kids active, keeps them social and entertained, and gives them superb levels of protection. Use it to Call, Entertain, Educate & Locate...All bases covered? We certainly think so.BRILLAR FunctionsHow It WorksParents set an activity challenge via Roodymentary app. Roody HQ calls the child directly on their device with the task...Pretty cool, huh..?As they complete their tasks, they are rewarded with stickers...Then badges and special costumes to dress Roody up withThe best bit, they get to show off and congratulate friends with our peer recognition feature

Unlike Any Other Kids' GPS Tracking Service  - The Roody Factor

The incentive is named Roody – the hero of our app Roodymentary.
Children can design their own ‘Roody’ character – Roody (our platform), at a time of your choosing makes a personalised one-way (not a two way converstion) call to the child on their Brillar device, giving them a rudimental but stimulating challenge of your choosing. hunt. Once completed and approved by you, they then get to share that success with their pals for that all important peer recognition. It can also be used to convert any message you want into a voice message from Roody.
