research, the wafer thin film is not appropriate for users wearing gloves in
snow sports or extreme outdoor activities where an environment of heavy dust is
present. At this time, a user will have to sacrifice using the home key finger
print identity feature on their iPhones in order to have water/dust/mud
resistance, in some instances. However, we have made significant efforts toward
keeping the iPhone bio-metric reader working while maintaining the
water/dust/dirt proof performance. We will keep you posted as we make progress
on this issue.
Q: Do aftermarket audio jacks fit?
A: With its 7mm opening at
the audio connector, the case will be able to accommodate the majority of
aftermarket audio jacks. However, if they don’t fit, an audio extender is
included in the package.
Q: How does the new iPhone 6S design comply with the
Xtreme Waterproof Case design?
A: Our Xtreme case will be
compatible with both the iPhone 6 and 6S. We are preparing for the iPhone 6S release,
and are ensuring that the fundamentals of the Xtreme case design remain intact
while keeping in mind the changes that are happening to the device. If any
challenging issues arise with the Xtreme case for the iPhone 6S, we will
immediately inform you of the possible impact it may have to the design. Since
we are not able to predict the exact time of the iPhone 6S launch, the Xtreme
case launch won’t be set on a strict timeline. If the iPhone 6S release time is
later than we anticipated, it may impact our predicted schedule.
Q: How does the waterproof construction impact the
speaker performance?
A: Per our study, the Xtreme water resistant case should have a unique
configuration to prevent the system from water damage.  To accomplish this, the case requires a unique
membrane to cover the bottom speakers, and a waterproof membrane that can
transfer sound, but not water, for the top ear speaker. There might be a slight
muffling effect with sound losses of around 10% to 30% caused by the unique
water resistance design. The majority of waterproof cases on the market have this
same issue. This is something a user must be willing to trade off for the
benefit of having a water resistant case.

Q: Is iPhone 6 Plus pre-order available in this campaign?
A: No, our Indiegogo campaign is dedicated only for the
iPhone 6/ 6S Xtreme waterproof case. The 6 Plus case development is in
progress, but don't have a launch timeline to share right now. We will
immediately inform you about the Xtreme iPhone 6 Plus waterproof case
development details as we exceed our funding goal. The best way to stay in the
loop on our latest news and product launches is to sign up for our Facebook
mailing list.


Final Thanks You and Link

We feel so grateful to
everyone who has taken the time to read our campaign and for those who
contributed what they could to make a difference and in helping us to spread
the word.  We have spent the last few
months working hard to bring our vision to life and it has been worth every
minute, thanks to all our generous supporters. 
Please know your efforts, even the smallest, haven’t gone unnoticed. We
will continue to keep you posted on what your pledge helped us to achieve. You
are part of our BRICWAVE™ family.

If you cannot pledge but you are interested in
helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might
even be able to earn perks just by spreading the word!

Contact Us
Website: www.bricwave.com
Help to Spread the Word
around the World!
If you have any questions,
comments, or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would
love to hear from you! Please feel free to contact us at info@bricwave.com

story:
Who I am

I'm a structural engineer, actually a young scientist, a PhD student, working on specific, but very common problems.

What I'm doing

The shear phenomenon is a problem passionately studied for more than a century, but not yet solved.

The second problem is maybe even more important and unknown – shear in reinforced concrete columns with circular cross section. It’s more important, because it can saves lives, our lives.

Why I'm doing it

This kind of columns is too widely used around our everyday round– we inhabit buildings with circular columns, we drive on bridges supported by circular columns.

After every big earthquake, researchers have started with the investigation of the behaviour of these columns under shear and finished with no success. De Cossio was the pioneer in 1965 after the big Mexico City earthquake. Only one more major experimental program was conducted worldwide.

Do we have to wait for the next disaster to start working on it again?

The recommendations for evaluating of the shear strength of circular RC columns in the most national codes are limited or they are based on rectangular sections, despite the fact that their behaviour are quite different. Sometimes, these recommendations are not existing at all.

The Goals

I want to achieve a practical, analytical model for designing these columns under shear. I want to make it easy to use, so different codes can implement it. 

The experiments that I'll conduct are quite different than everything previous - the main parameters are only mentioned in the past. Some of them are the longitudinal strains, the compression force and the actual cross section.

Personal practical backgroung

We have started with a small experimental program with basic and not very precise equipment, unable to simulate a cyclic, seismic action. We, my scientific mentor and I, worked passionately on it, but it's not enough at all.

In spite of all, these experiments showed good and interesting results, but not enough for a model.
Also, I have tried to make a quasi-dynamic experiment, which gave a good result.

The funding is for

The funding I need is for proper and modern equipment, for software and specimens for the future experimental program.  I already have video and laser extensometers, but I need a universal testing machine which can control the deformations and be able to simulate the cyclic loading.

Also, a shaking table is the thing that can improve the experiments and simulate a real record of earthquake.

Why you should support me

I believe that the investments we've made in the past three years can be developed further and can gain a practical value and be implemented in the design codes. This will not just help us to build safer buildings, bridges and facilities, but save lives and supports the economy.
I invite everyone who is working on this kind of problems to contact me, so we can share information and knowledge, to discuss the problems and give opinions and advices.

story:
Don't miss  SPECIAL OFFER! 





Our story 

Hi friends!

My name is Igor.

I, as well as most of you have a personal smartphone and I use it very often.

My friend Konstantin has a smartphone, my elder brother Den, my little sister Sarah, who is 13 years old, and all my friends too.

And we all want to charge our phones quickly and anywhere we are.

So, we with Konstantin created LetzCharge! 

LetzCharge this handy charger for your smartphone, and you can easily take it with you because he's going into a comfortable trinket for your bunch of keys! You can personalize your style with any trinket which you want! You will never lose your keys with a magnetic closure. Enjoy!


LetzCharge is 

  • SYNC / CHARGE CABLE
  • ALWAYS WITH YOU
  • SUPPORT YOUR PERSONAL STYLE
  • AVAILABLE LENGHT 70 or 230 mm

You can order any character that you want, for example, you can use your head, scaned on the 3D printer! See SPECIAL Perk! 

Now available 5 characters:


Sizes: 
  •    70 x 12 x 10 mm 
  • 230 x 12 x 10 mm


Each of them is available with Lightning(MFi) or MicroUSB connector.

Lightning for Apple production:

   - iPhone 5,  iPhone 5,  iPhone 5s,  iPhone 6,  iPhone 6 plus

   - iPad mini,  iPad mini 2,  iPad mini 3,  iPad Air 2,  iPad Air 3,  iPad with Retina                display

   - iPod touch 5th Generation  16GB / 32GB / 64GB,  iPod nano 7th  Generation

 MicroUSB for every mobile phone or tablet PC with MicroUSB

   - Android - Samsung Galaxy, HTC, LG, etc.

   - Windows Phone - All versions

   - Blackberry - All versions


                                   


LetzCharge Working Prototype:


                                          


Stretch goals


Stretch trinkets


To what will be used your fees?

 
Risks and Challenges:

We have a strong and established with our manufacturing partner in Shenzhen, who has been manufacturing grade A quality products for all his customers. We also have another manufacturer in Hong Kong as a backup. They both have been proven with high production capability, therefore manufacturing risk is at a minimum. 

As for the challenge of delivery, we have already produced fully functional cables and are already setup to start mass production. Our past experience with shipping thought us that anything can happen to cause delays: (i.e: production delays, parts delivery, Carrier delays, Holidays etc.). Our experience allows us to make sure your perks arrive on time.

Delivery:

Now LetzCharge is available in 2 versions: micro USB or lightning. The lightning version will be MFi certified, this means the connectors will be from an Apple certified manufacturer, MFi components have a waiting period of 3-6 month, but we took care of that already and pre-ordered the lightning connectors in Dec 2014. So, it will not affect to your delivery time.

story:
Product Description

SmartO² is a Bluetooth Oxygen Analyser for Nitrox and Trimix scuba divers.
More and more recreational/technical Scuba divers use Nitrox and or Trimix in their tanks to either enjoy longer dives, shorter surface intervals or to have more conservative dives. But diving with a gas with high Oxygen content has its own risks, and it's common practice for a diver to use specialized Oxygen Analyzer to check the Oxygen content of their scuba tank before using it.
Unfortunately, those Analysers are quite expensive and have very limited features. We think that every diver should have his own Personal Oxygen Analyser. That's why we develop the SmartO² !

SmartO² have 2 main components: 

A measuring unit and an Analyzing unit. 
  • The measuring unit consist of our proprietary board that reads an Oxygen Sensor, the outside temperature, the relative humidity and sends all these data via a Bluetooth connection to a Smartphone. 
  • The Analyzing unit is the free SmartO² Application running on your smartphone/tablet.
SmartO² is designed to operate with any Oxygen Sensor that provide an output signal between 7 to 15 mV like Teledyne R-22S,  Molex oxygen cell NANM01, Maxtec MAX-305 & MAX-305F, Analytical Industries Inc. PSR-11-39-MD


SmartO² have 3 main operating modes: 

Calibration, Analyser and Dive parameters calculator

    

  • Calibration: For all sensors hardware, calibration is the most reference step, if this step is wrong or bad the final analysis is not good. It is common practice to calibrate an analyser before each use. With SmartO² it's quite simple as the smartphone, in addition to showing the profile of your measurements, will also save the resulting calibration as a reference for an defined time that will be used for subsequent analysis. An optional compensation parameter is present for the Temperature/Relative Humidity because when you choose air as calibrating choice, the Oxygen percentage in the air is not always the same and depend of this coefficient. Thanks to the pressure restrictor with a DIN fitting which can be used directly in a DIN cylinder valve or in an A clamp with a DIN female fitting, and aa tee piece are used. Not use the pressure restrictor can creates high pressure and cold air on the sensor face and can permanantely damage the sensor. A poor fit can cause a "Venturi effect" drawing fresh air into the sensor an generate an artificially high reading.
  • Analyser: In analyzer mode, you can program the SmartO² to perform an analysis on a defined time limit fixed by the user in the settings screen.
  • Dive Parameters calculator: This screen display in meters or in feets the differents parameters of a Scuba Dive, like the maximum depth (M.O.D.) or the air depth equivalent for those who are diving with air table.
SmartO² is powered by an rechargeable 3.7V / 850mA Lithium/Polymer battery 

                            


Product Benefits

SmartO² innovative architecture moves the data computation and data display from the stand alone analyser to the smartphone, resulting in a more cost effective and flexible solution when compared to conventional Oxygen Analyzers.
Additionally, the ability to digitally log each measurement provide a clear benefit to the diver.

Supported devices

SmartO² use Bluetooth technology and therefore it will be connected to devices that support this technology. 
We have first develop an Androïd application but we don't forget the iOS and Windows world, we will work on these OS soon, depending of the Androïd success. 

Project Status

We started working on this project almost one year ago, we had a proof of concept last winter and we made some private demonstration to some technical divers.
So now we move forward with the productization phase and we now have some functional prototypes of the circuit board, its related firmware, a beta App for the Samsung Galaxy 3, 4 & 5, and a 3D printed prototype of the housing.

    


We are currently in the process of manufacturing the last version of the PCB so as soon as these boards are testing, we can freeze the embedded code and the App.
Upon completion of this Indiegogo campaign we will finalize the design of the housing and proceed with the design and manufacturing of the production molds. 

Technical Specifications

  • 95 x 50 x 35 mm.
  • Weight is only 61g without Oxygen Sensor
  • 10h battery autonomy ( +/- 100 measures )
  • Sensirion SHT31 Humidity and Temperature Sensor
  • Bluetooth 3.0 Class 2 module, iOS and Android compatible
  • 3 led for status indication ( red, green, blue )
  • 850mAh LiPo battery with low discharge protection circuit
  • LiPo charger integrated
  • PIC 24FJ256GB206 Processor
  • Belgian Made


Manufacturing Plan

Upon the successful completion of the Indiegogo campaign, we will place production orders for enought kits to accommodate Indiegogo backers. We are also planning to launch a second, and larger production lot to support our market launch. After that, we will progressively increase manufacturing volumes based on market demand.

We have already identified the factory that will produce the boards and we are in the process of selecting a manufacturer for the molds and the housings. Lastly, we will obtain quotations from the vendors of the Oxygen sensors we plan to use in SmartO².

We plan to assemble the units, test them and manage orders fulfilment at our location in Belgium.

Once the Indiegogo phase will be completed, customers will be able to purchase SmartO² directly from our store or from authorized retailers.


Cost

Where your money goes



Initial costs for hardware product are very high. Prices drop with larger quantities but costs like production tooling and certification are big hurdles for startups.

Have you ever wondered  what the CE symbols on the back on your electronics products stand for ? They certify that the products are safe to use. In order to produce the measuring unit,we have to go through many tests of electromagnetic compatibility to safety tests. 

Therein lies the essence of crowfunding. You help small teams like us to build something which would otherwise be impossible to make. Thank you very much!


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

How can I charge the SmartO² ?

Connect any USB compatible power adapter to the micro USB port of the SmartO². The delivery will not include the micro USB cable, nor the power adapter. You can also charge the SmartO²  by connecting it to your computer, but it will take a little bit longer than with a power adapter because the SmartO² won't be recognized as an USB device.

Are shipping costs included in the prices of the perks?

No, you have to add the stated shipping costs depending on your country, except for Belgium and France.  


What you will get

For one perk you will get a fully functional SmartO² with an enclosure made by injection moulding, a new oxygen sensor and a M26 adaptor for 300 bars.

Plug your SmartO² into an USB charger or an USB plug, charge until the red LED lights down, and then you can start to test the oxygen % of your diving bottle with you new instrument. 

5 € Pledge: We like You too!

35 € Pledge: A SmartO² T-Shirt in your choice of sex / color / size. See images below.

          


169 € Pledge:  A Smart O² without sensor

This is the perfect option if you already have an Oxygen sensor laying around in your gear bag. You will receive a SmartO² Base (saving 30,00 € from the list price of 199,00 €). This option does NOT include the Oxygen sensor. We will also send project updates and mention you on our Facebook page. Free shipping for Belgium and France, add 10,00 € for all other EU regions For non-EU backers, note that shipping date will depend on when we will get the certification for your specific country.

235 € Pledge:  A Smart O² "Ready to go"

This option is for a fully assembled Smart O² ready to go, that INCLUDES a new Oxygen sensor (and you will save 54,00 € from the list price of 289,00 € Free shipping for Belgium and France, add 10,00 € for all other EU regions For non-EU backers, note that shipping date will depend on when we will get the certification for your specific country


Other Ways You Can Help

Please talk about this Indiegogo campaign and talk to your friends, make a post on Facebook, send your local Diving club the link of the campaign. This may help to make this campaign a success.


Risks & Challenges

SmartO², while innovative, is a simple to understand/simple to use product and we are on track to ship early production units in July. Still the challenges of designing and manufacturing this kind of product are quite significant, and any minor issue is one of the project components could lead to significant delays.

Design Challenges:
While the board design is completed there are still a few potential risks related to the design that could force us to modify and/or redesign the board. The most critical area is EMI Compliance even if the used component is EMI compiliant by itself. SmartO² is a wireless product and as such it must meet established regulations. In the design of the SmartO² board we have used state-of-the-art methodologies, we have leverage the RF component of our SmartO² product ( that has already obtained FCC certification ). Nevertheless, Radio Frequency design is never easy and "surprises" are not uncommon.
Another Hardware related risk is the design of the housing for SmartO²: while we already have a working prototype of a printed 3D model, going from prototype to production units could create some unanticiped issues with the housing, and delay the overall program.
In addition to the possible hardwares issues, there could also be some software related issues either because of functionality or because of interoperability with smartphones/tablets.
Regarding the functionality of the product, our plan is to use the next 6 weeks to extend beta testing and to collect as much feedback as possible.
Regarding the support for iOS and Windows 8 smartphone, we expect to have a beta App for these Operating system before end of year.

Manufacturing Challenges:
While we have already identified the manufacturers for the main parts ( PCB and O² sensors ) and have provided them with design documents, there could still be delays in creating production tools for the housing, setting up production lines and production test fixtures.
We plan to have reviews with the vendors and address any potential issues as soon as we become aware of them.

This option does NOT include the Oxygen sensor. We will also send project updates and mention you on our Facebook page. Free shipping for Belgium and France, add 10,00 € for all other EU regions  For non-EU backers, note that shipping date will depend on when we will get the certification for your specific country.
235 € Pledge:  A Smart O² "Ready to go"This option is for a fully assembled Smart O² ready to go, that INCLUDES a new Oxygen sensor (and you will save 54,00 € from the list price of 289,00 €  Free shipping for Belgium and France, add 10,00 € for all other EU regions  For non-EU backers, note that shipping date will depend on when we will get the certification for your specific country

Other Ways You Can Help


Please talk about this Indiegogo campaign and talk to your friends, make a post on Facebook, send your local Diving club the link of the campaign. This may help to make this campaign a success.


Risks & Challenges
SmartO², while innovative, is a simple to understand/simple to use product and we are on track to ship early production units in July. Still the challenges of designing and manufacturing this kind of product are quite significant, and any minor issue is one of the project components could lead to significant delays.


Design Challenges:

While the board design is completed there are still a few potential risks related to the design that could force us to modify and/or redesign the board. The most critical area is EMI Compliance even if the used component is EMI compiliant by itself. SmartO² is a wireless product and as such it must meet established regulations. In the design of the SmartO² board we have used state-of-the-art methodologies, we have leverage the RF component of our SmartO² product ( that has already obtained FCC certification ). Nevertheless, Radio Frequency design is never easy and "surprises" are not uncommon.
Another Hardware related risk is the design of the housing for SmartO²: while we already have a working prototype of a printed 3D model, going from prototype to production units could create some unanticiped issues with the housing, and delay the overall program.
In addition to the possible hardwares issues, there could also be some software related issues either because of functionality or because of interoperability with smartphones/tablets.
Regarding the functionality of the product, our plan is to use the next 6 weeks to extend beta testing and to collect as much feedback as possible.
Regarding the support for iOS and Windows 8 smartphone, we expect to have a beta App for these Operating system before end of year.

Manufacturing Challenges:
While we have already identified the manufacturers for the main parts ( PCB and O² sensors ) and have provided them with design documents, there could still be delays in creating production tools for the housing, setting up production lines and production test fixtures.
We plan to have reviews with the vendors and address any potential issues as soon as we become aware of them.

story:
Summary

What is Kodi?

What is Kodi Assist?

Note: The app is free and the update will be free. Source code will be released too. Campaign is just to launch the development.

It is very simple. I have been developing Kodi Assist for a while. It's the most popular Kodi remote out there on the platform. Moreover, it's open source. It has been going great. Next logical step is to raise the bar higher and launch the app for upcoming Windows 10 platform.


The work is already in progress. However the my workstation broke down. It's broken bad. Now we need funds to get the development going.

What We Need & What You Get

What we specifically need, is a decent computer to use for development. Right now, my best bet for daily computing needs is a Nexus 7 connected to a mouse and a keyboard. That clearly doesn't cut it. Work machine is the priority and most of the funding is going towards that. Rest, if any, will go towards necessary tools.

In return, Windows 10 gets a quality app. In addition, complete source code will be available for anyone to see, refer to, or reuse. Here is a token - a promise.

In case the campaign doesn't reach the goal, I will try to fund. But there are no guarantees. App may get delayed. App may never come into existence.

The Impact

This project isn't just about the app. It has been a symbol for Windows Phone's open source community. It has shown that great apps can come out of third party developers. It has shown that open source doesn't equate to ugly mess. Most important of all, it has given Windows Phone a unique app. And there aren't a lot of those on Store.

If this funding succeeds, we will have built the very first successful open source project for Windows 10 universal platform. And since anyone can refer to the source code, it will be point of reference for developers who want to build for the platform. An example to follow. A start for bringing developers to the platform.

Risks & Challenges

As with any open source contribution, the biggest challenge is going to be human resources. Yes, I do take care of most of the development. But life happens and things get delayed.

Secondly, the platform itself isn't mature enough yet. Design language is still being established and altered. Platform APIs are changing. This might require app to change itself frequently.

However, despite those problems we have built apps for Windows Phone 8 and 8.1. We have done it not just once but twice. We can do it again.

Other Ways You Can Help

The best part about this project is that you can still help even if you cannot fund. Here are some suggestions:
  • Ask others to fund. Share as much as you can. A little attention from a big company can help a lot.
  • Contribute to the code, design, and testing. That's the spirit of open source.
  • Help with the translations.

story:
Changing charging culture, together!

We are putting power in people's hands. As an Oomf user, you'll have access to portable, fast, reliable power anywhere there's an Oomf PowerHouse--think bars, restaurants, salons, stadiums, cafés, cruise ships, ski resorts, anywhere. The more funds we raise, the faster we'll be everywhere.

Our goal is to give 'Power to the People', for free. We believe everyone should have easy access to a convenient and reliable power source. 

Imagine a brand gifting you a charge in exchange for engaging with a relevant brand experience. Mind blown? That's because we're not just changing charging culture, we're changing commerce. If that's not your cup of tea, you'll always have the option to pay for your power instead.

Freedom. Power. Connection. With Oomf, you are free to walk around while you charge. Oomf fully charges phones within an hour, with reliable power and certified cables. No need to remember to bring a cord, cable or adaptor. You can rest easy and enjoy your time because you're connected, and reachable if you want to be.

You're in charge, and the power is in your hands.


What We Need & What You Get

It's 2015, and it's time to put an end to "tethered charging". Oomf gives everyone access to power and the freedom of portability. Oomf will be available where and when you need it the most. The more money we raise, the faster we can be everywhere.

Funds from this campaign will go directly to help purchasing our smart chargers, finalizing manufacturing, some general expenses, and a touch of marketing efforts as we roll out our new product to the world!

We're looking to raise $150,000 in order to purchase enough chargers for 300 PowerHouses (businesses) in the Boston area. People are tired of their phones dying while they're out enjoying life with no convenient and reliable means to recharging their mobile devices. Bostonians will be amongst the first to receive Oomf charging and then it's quickly onto the surrounding cities so that everyone can recharge using Oomf. The businesses you frequent are ready to take delivery of our new charging solution and we need your help!

Our perks are designed to give you all a piece of our project, from Oomf apparel, to an office visit, a date with a co-founder, and the opportunity to be one of the first 300 businesses to offer oomf after we work out the bugs during the Beta test. Finally, as a token of our appreciation, we are also offering a Oomf Home Edition PowerStations for our special Indegogo friends, family and supporters.

It’s a win-win for all involved! 

Oomf Users, love Oomf Chargers because of it's portability. It allows you to keep your devices charged in an easy, affordable, safe, and comfortable way - perfect for the on-the-go millennial! Bonus: if you refer this service to friends, you can accumulate free charges!

Oomf PowerHouses (Local Businesses), especially bars and restaurants, love this idea. They are able to easily provide a charging solution to customers, without needing to worry about any extra cost or liability issues.

Oomf Platform Advertisers (Brands), those cool brands that stand for things, want to reach people and give them something of real value in exchange for a one-on-one experience with their brand with endless opportunities to engage people. 

Oomf PowerHouse

With our mobile app, you can find an Oomf PowerHouse that is closest to you. (Or, you can happen upon it by noticing our sticker in the window, a table tent or a coaster in the venue.) 

Then, grab or ask for an Oomf Charger, sign into the Oomf App, add a payment method (you only have to do this once... might as well do it now: oomf.it), enter the code printed on the back of Oomf charger. Plug it in at any point and voilà, you're charging! You can even have a friend activate your charger from their phone if yours is completely dead. Either way, just don't forget to return it. We'll have to charge you (or your friend) if you don't, and we don't want to have to do that. The Oomf charger can only be recharged on our charging stations, so it'll be useless to you once it's dead.

Oomf PowerStation

Oomf Rental & Return Process

To rent an Oomf, the process is as simple as can be. Users ask a bartender or waitress for an Oomf (speaking in the context of bars and restaurants, but any sales person will be able to help). Anytime throughout the process of launching the app and entering the code, users can pull out the appropriate charging cable (apple or micro-usb) and plug it into their device.

When users are done, they simply return the Oomf to a PowerStation at its original PowerHouse to avoid late fees or device replacement charges.

The charger will blink blue when it's placed correctly and for extra good-feelings, the PowerStation will send you a quick text or email thank you, to let you know it was replaced successfully. Don't worry, we'll send you text or email reminders if you accidentally walk out with it too. We've got your back because we want them back.

The credit card service we use is top rated for security and confidentiality of your personal information. (We're paying top dollar for it too, but it's important.)

Oomf's Oomph

Once activated, the power flows into the phone as fast as is safe for the phones. Phones can charge from 0 - 100% in roughly 45 to 60 minutes. Each charger has enough 'oomph' to fully charge two phones.

Fun side note: two phones can be charged at once, as long as one is using the apple connection and the other uses the micro-usb. Perfect for geek-chic couples. 

Oomf Loves All Phones

Speaking of geeks (an endearing term we are proud to call ourselves) and the chic, Oomf loves all phones, supporting charging of any micro-usb device as well as any 8-pin lightning connector apple device.

So yes grandma, your 2005 flip phone can still be charged as long as it has a micro-USB port (don't worry about it grandma, it does), you'll just need to call me and I'll activate it for you, wherever I am. Oomf: A network of powerful, portable smart chargers people can rent while out, living a mobile life.

Oomf Power Activation

All you need to remember is that you need to visit the site or have the app to activate the charger and that it's all-in-one. (So you don't need to remember to bring any adaptors or to carry any cords, ever again. Leave them at home, where they belong. Please. And stop bothering bartenders to check your texts.) 

Once you plug your device into an Oomf, the Oomf charger just needs to be 'activated' (power is remotely turned on) by going to the mobile or web app and entering the 4-digit code on the back of the device. It doesn't matter whether its from your device or from a friend's device, or where in the world that friend may be. As long as the app receives the code from the charger you want to turn on (based on the 4-digit unique identifier code) it can be activated online, from anywhere in the world. It's a bit confusing to my grandma, so please excuse the lengthy explanation.

POWER TO THE PEOPLE, POWERED BY THE PEOPLE.

It's magical when people come together to make life a little bit better for everyone. Well, everyone with a battery operated mobile device. It seems the world could use a little more magic these days.

We want to invite the Indiegogo community into what we are doing and welcome people to be a part of our story. The beauty behind many of our rewards is that you will see exactly where your contribution is being invested into our company. It is important to us to recognize the individuals who join together into this powerful collective, as a piece of what makes this movement so ... powerful. (Only if you want to be recognized, of course. Anonymous donations are welcome and special too).

______________________________

BACKSTORY

Since you're still reading, we'll take you through the whole story.

From the beginning inspirations of Oomf... before it was even called Oomf, to our funding up until this point to our stretch goals if we raise more than our Indiegogo goals.

THE IDEA 

This idea of powering people on the go came from our original co-founder and CEO, James Riel, a Northeastern University graduate, while he traveled to San Diego for his annual 4th of July trip, in 2014. He was out with his buddies at a bar and he was running low on battery. James, like countless others, asked the bartender if he could charge his phone and to his surprise the bartender provided him a fully charged portable Mophie case. James was beside himself, he could stay mobile while charging his phone at the bar, and he didn't have to let the bar commandeer his phone. It wasn't a perfect solution, but it was a start that ignited the entrepreneurial fuel in James, yet again. A fuel so pure and powerful that it did not dwindle.

James saw the potential in providing portable power to customers at bars and restaurants and made it his mission to create a real solution for people everywhere.

THE CO-FOUNDERS

Oomf Co-founders, James Riel (left), and Dan Lawless (right)

Co-founder and CTO, Dan didn’t know him that well at the time, but after hanging out with him he was drawn in by James's drive and passion for the idea. After a few meetings, Dan was sold. They began to work through the logistics. There were a ton of questions to ask and answer. James and Dan released an alpha-model product in only a few months of coming up with the idea. It was all pretty much all off the shelf hardware, but at the time they couldn't be too picky. They were bootstrapping.

Wallets were emptying and James's baggie of coins was dwindling. Seriously. He had a bag of coins. And then there was $0.17 left. Dan was still full-time at another job and started to split his salary with James so that they could both afford to work on the project. And eat. They knew timing would be crucial, getting to market fast was and still is of major importance. All their eggs are lovingly placed in this basket.

THE FIRST PROTOTYPE

                                   PowerUp chargers: Oomf Alpha-model

James and Dan got amazing feedback and praise after releasing alpha-model Oomf Chargers (called "PowerUp Chargers" at the time) to almost 25 bars and restaurants in the Boston area. Vindication! Consumers and business owners alike found the solution incredibly useful.

Oomf customers loved the portability and not being tethered to a wall or station Oomf Customers loved the convenience Oomf Customers did not like the mess of wires that came with the device Oomf PowerHouses had a hard time managing it Our business model was not sustainable as a sale model 80% of Oomf PowerHouses wanted a more affordable solution Needed theft protection Oomf PowerHouses did not want to assume liability Oomf Chargers were used approximately 10 times a day on busy days (Thursday - Sunday).

They also found some major holes that needed solid solutions in order to successfully drive the idea into the future. This formulated the basis for the first and perhaps most crucial pivot and the means to support it.


TIME + MONEY + PASSION

ANGEL INVESTOR TURNED BOOTSTRAPPING 3RD CO-FOUNDER 

Eight months in, the co-founders knew they needed to raise money to evolve and bring a true solution to market and the baggie with $0.17 left just wasn't going to cut it anymore. Their goal when shopping an initial pitch deck around was to find someone who would bring more to Oomf then 'just' cash. 

Joining Oomf full-time himself as the third co-founder and VP of Engineering, Gavin Gray commits a large cash injection as well as his extensive experience and professional expertise to the team.

As charismatic and passionate as the original founders, Gavin inspired several of the best and brightest of those within his vast, extensive career network to be a part of our growing team.

THE TEAM

We believe in the power of attraction. We think positive thoughts, we know we will be successful and we know it's only a matter of time before we change the world. Changing charging culture is only the proof we need to execute our evolving vision on a larger scale. 

Our team is a group of brightly shining stars, a perfect potion of advertising and business professionals, technical developers and engineers. The four executives are fully committed, working full-time on a startup schedule, which pretty much means around the clock while everyone else is devoted to putting in as much part-time hours as they can while juggling full-time industry jobs. 

Our company policy instructs everyone to take as much vacation as needed and that birthdays are considered national holidays, but we all seem to be so captivated by the light that we can't stay away. We love it.

The Oomf team started from a tested alpha-model concept and moved into production with a new solution in just over six months. That's six months of part-time dedication and teamwork and bootstrapped funding. (Most of the team is making this dream come true strictly based on equity.) 

We prototyped the hardware then developed it, we conceptualized the software then programmed it. We have lined up all our manufacturing and will be ready to release by the end of the year.

Every one of us believes in what we are doing and we would all love if the Indiegogo community can feel how we feel, and believe in Oomf as much as we do. Co-founder Dan Lawless will even give you the fuller story if you email him and ask: lawless@theoomf.com


THE EVOLVING PIVOT

Based on the ever-changing industry landscape and our collective ideas and capabilities, our model shifted from an off-the-shelf alpha version to the beautiful smart system we're ready to mass produce today.

[THE TECH] Oomf technology evolves continuously, bulletproofing our service time and time again. Largely, the Oomf model evolved to activate chargers via our proprietary cloud system as well, meaning no data is transferred through the wires, only power. For one, will be able to alert Oomf users if they take the device away from the PowerHouse, reminding them where it came from (and where to return it) to avoid fees for replacement and redistribution. All PowerStations are remotely monitored, to keep tabs on things like battery integrity and device management, making sure that people get the power they need.

[THE APP] The fact that there is an app is both a pivot and evolution. It works seamlessly with the new solution and cloud system to provide a simple service with unseen, utmost sophistication on the back end. For consumers, the Oomf App includes a navigation map so the power hungry can find Oomf PowerHouses hosting Oomf Chargers. This helps consumers choose where and how they want to spend their time most effectively, if their sole purpose is charging. Twenty minutes to spare? I might get a manicure while I wait. Or I'll pop over to a pub for a beer. Or two. Maybe I'll have some some broccoli bites too. Mmmm.

The app also rewards loyal users with a way to accumulate free charges based off referrals and overall usage. Return reminders, low battery alerts and quick route navigation to the closest Oomf PowerHouses are all on the list for features to design and create. Same for being able to see how many Oomf Chargers are in use, in real time, at any Oomf PowerHouse. That'll come in handy. It's all a matter of time. And money.

[THE INTEGRITY] This is only included in the pivot because it wasn't necessary before. Now that we've baked in so much intelligence into our chargers, we make it a point to clarify that our cables provide only power, no data transfer. Any volunteered data given through our mobile app will help us to customize relevant advertising experiences to users down the road, maximizing relevancy and valued relationships between consumers and brands.

[THE LIABILITY] By providing our solution as a service, we limit businesses' liability for charging people's phones. People keep their phones on them and borrow/rent our devices in the PowerHouses. PowerHouses aren't responsible for Oomf chargers walking out the door. The only lift of a finger for businesses is opening the new box and stacking the (automatically shipped) replacement Oomf charger on the PowerStation. 

[THE SALES MODEL] From a sales model to a pay per use model, and eventually to one that will be free to Oomf Customers through engaged advertising experiences, our sales docs have seen a lot of edits. That's what the alpha model was and what beta is for though, refining these details before we go global at a massive scale.

[THE DESIGN] From a design standpoint, Oomf needed to be user-friendly and attractive. Keeping everything Oomf customers loved about the product (mainly the portability), we cleaned up the mess of attachable cables with a shift into an all-in-one device, with dual charging ports. It makes it extremely manageable for both Oomf PowerHouses and users. 

[THE BRAND] The name was the first thing to tackle. Starting as PowerUp Chargers, shifting to IonRecharge then finally landing on Oomf within the first week of hiring Jennie. Focused on being a wise source for creating transformational moments for people in search for power, Oomf strives for an intangible, magical presence--deeply connected with the human condition.

[THE SALES] Less of a pivot and more of an evolution, our sales team loves securing Oomf PowerHouses because it's so easy, with our new Oomf product model. We have a 90% success rate in just over a month of pre-sales. 300 Oomf PowerHouses are signed up and ready to go.


OUR VISION

To change commerce, by exchanging branded experiences for goods and services of present, tangible value.

               

Risks & Challenges

As a startup we are familiar with the many challenges and obstacles that can arise along the way, but you can rest easy knowing the team that makes Oomf possible is one you can trust to deliver. 
Once funded, we'll be setting up nearly 300 businesses, locally to provide Oomf charging to their customers. Our organizational efforts thus far give us confidence in being able to deliver on our mission in a timely manner. We'll continually update our community of backers if anything arises in which may cause a delay. Thank you all for truly believing in our project!

Other Ways You Can Help

This is truly a product for the people, so please help us spread the word about Oomf and use Indiegogo's sharing tools to help us tell everyone that a better way to recharge is on the way!

Once you plug your device into an Oomf, the Oomf charger just needs to be 'activated' (power is remotely turned on) by going to the mobile or web app and entering the 4-digit code on the back of the device. It doesn't matter whether its from your device or from a friend's device, or where in the world that friend may be. As long as the app receives the code from the charger you want to turn on (based on the 4-digit unique identifier code) it can be activated online, from anywhere in the world. It's a bit confusing to my grandma, so please excuse the lengthy explanation.
POWER TO THE PEOPLE, POWERED BY THE PEOPLE.


It's magical when people come together to make life a little bit better for everyone. Well, everyone with a battery operated mobile device. It seems the world could use a little more magic these days.
We want to invite the Indiegogo community into what we are doing and welcome people to be a part of our story. The beauty behind many of our rewards is that you will see exactly where your contribution is being invested into our company. It is important to us to recognize the individuals who join together into this powerful collective, as a piece of what makes this movement so ... powerful. (Only if you want to be recognized, of course. Anonymous donations are welcome and special too).
______________________________

BACKSTORY
Since you're still reading, we'll take you through the whole story.
From the beginning inspirations of Oomf... before it was even called Oomf, to our funding up until this point to our stretch goals if we raise more than our Indiegogo goals.
THE IDEA 
This idea of powering people on the go came from our original co-founder and CEO, James Riel, a Northeastern University graduate, while he traveled to San Diego for his annual 4th of July trip, in 2014. He was out with his buddies at a bar and he was running low on battery. James, like countless others, asked the bartender if he could charge his phone and to his surprise the bartender provided him a fully charged portable Mophie case. James was beside himself, he could stay mobile while charging his phone at the bar, and he didn't have to let the bar commandeer his phone. It wasn't a perfect solution, but it was a start that ignited the entrepreneurial fuel in James, yet again. A fuel so pure and powerful that it did not dwindle.
James saw the potential in providing portable power to customers at bars and restaurants and made it his mission to create a real solution for people everywhere.
THE CO-FOUNDERS

Oomf Co-founders, James Riel (left), and Dan Lawless (right)
Co-founder and CTO, Dan didn’t know him that well at the time, but after hanging out with him he was drawn in by James's drive and passion for the idea. After a few meetings, Dan was sold. They began to work through the logistics. There were a ton of questions to ask and answer. James and Dan released an alpha-model product in only a few months of coming up with the idea. It was all pretty much all off the shelf hardware, but at the time they couldn't be too picky. They were bootstrapping.
Wallets were emptying and James's baggie of coins was dwindling. Seriously. He had a bag of coins. And then there was $0.17 left. Dan was still full-time at another job and started to split his salary with James so that they could both afford to work on the project. And eat. They knew timing would be crucial, getting to market fast was and still is of major importance. All their eggs are lovingly placed in this basket.
THE FIRST PROTOTYPE

                                   PowerUp chargers: Oomf Alpha-model
   
James and Dan got amazing feedback and praise after releasing alpha-model Oomf Chargers (called "PowerUp Chargers" at the time) to almost 25 bars and restaurants in the Boston area. Vindication! Consumers and business owners alike found the solution incredibly useful.
Oomf customers loved the portability and not being tethered to a wall or station Oomf Customers loved the convenience Oomf Customers did not like the mess of wires that came with the device Oomf PowerHouses had a hard time managing it Our business model was not sustainable as a sale model 80% of Oomf PowerHouses wanted a more affordable solution Needed theft protection Oomf PowerHouses did not want to assume liability Oomf Chargers were used approximately 10 times a day on busy days (Thursday - Sunday).
They also found some major holes that needed solid solutions in order to successfully drive the idea into the future. This formulated the basis for the first and perhaps most crucial pivot and the means to support it.

TIME + MONEY + PASSION
ANGEL INVESTOR TURNED BOOTSTRAPPING 3RD CO-FOUNDER 
Eight months in, the co-founders knew they needed to raise money to evolve and bring a true solution to market and the baggie with $0.17 left just wasn't going to cut it anymore. Their goal when shopping an initial pitch deck around was to find someone who would bring more to Oomf then 'just' cash. 
Joining Oomf full-time himself as the third co-founder and VP of Engineering, Gavin Gray commits a large cash injection as well as his extensive experience and professional expertise to the team.
As charismatic and passionate as the original founders, Gavin inspired several of the best and brightest of those within his vast, extensive career network to be a part of our growing team.
THE TEAM

We believe in the power of attraction. We think positive thoughts, we know we will be successful and we know it's only a matter of time before we change the world. Changing charging culture is only the proof we need to execute our evolving vision on a larger scale. 
Our team is a group of brightly shining stars, a perfect potion of advertising and business professionals, technical developers and engineers. The four executives are fully committed, working full-time on a startup schedule, which pretty much means around the clock while everyone else is devoted to putting in as much part-time hours as they can while juggling full-time industry jobs. 
Our company policy instructs everyone to take as much vacation as needed and that birthdays are considered national holidays, but we all seem to be so captivated by the light that we can't stay away. We love it.
The Oomf team started from a tested alpha-model concept and moved into production with a new solution in just over six months. That's six months of part-time dedication and teamwork and bootstrapped funding. (Most of the team is making this dream come true strictly based on equity.) 
We prototyped the hardware then developed it, we conceptualized the software then programmed it. We have lined up all our manufacturing and will be ready to release by the end of the year.
Every one of us believes in what we are doing and we would all love if the Indiegogo community can feel how we feel, and believe in Oomf as much as we do. Co-founder Dan Lawless will even give you the fuller story if you email him and ask: lawless@theoomf.com

THE EVOLVING PIVOT
Based on the ever-changing industry landscape and our collective ideas and capabilities, our model shifted from an off-the-shelf alpha version to the beautiful smart system we're ready to mass produce today.
[THE TECH] Oomf technology evolves continuously, bulletproofing our service time and time again. Largely, the Oomf model evolved to activate chargers via our proprietary cloud system as well, meaning no data is transferred through the wires, only power. For one, will be able to alert Oomf users if they take the device away from the PowerHouse, reminding them where it came from (and where to return it) to avoid fees for replacement and redistribution. All PowerStations are remotely monitored, to keep tabs on things like battery integrity and device management, making sure that people get the power they need.
[THE APP] The fact that there is an app is both a pivot and evolution. It works seamlessly with the new solution and cloud system to provide a simple service with unseen, utmost sophistication on the back end. For consumers, the Oomf App includes a navigation map so the power hungry can find Oomf PowerHouses hosting Oomf Chargers. This helps consumers choose where and how they want to spend their time most effectively, if their sole purpose is charging. Twenty minutes to spare? I might get a manicure while I wait. Or I'll pop over to a pub for a beer. Or two. Maybe I'll have some some broccoli bites too. Mmmm.
The app also rewards loyal users with a way to accumulate free charges based off referrals and overall usage. Return reminders, low battery alerts and quick route navigation to the closest Oomf PowerHouses are all on the list for features to design and create. Same for being able to see how many Oomf Chargers are in use, in real time, at any Oomf PowerHouse. That'll come in handy. It's all a matter of time. And money.
[THE INTEGRITY] This is only included in the pivot because it wasn't necessary before. Now that we've baked in so much intelligence into our chargers, we make it a point to clarify that our cables provide only power, no data transfer. Any volunteered data given through our mobile app will help us to customize relevant advertising experiences to users down the road, maximizing relevancy and valued relationships between consumers and brands.
[THE LIABILITY] By providing our solution as a service, we limit businesses' liability for charging people's phones. People keep their phones on them and borrow/rent our devices in the PowerHouses. PowerHouses aren't responsible for Oomf chargers walking out the door. The only lift of a finger for businesses is opening the new box and stacking the (automatically shipped) replacement Oomf charger on the PowerStation. 
[THE SALES MODEL] From a sales model to a pay per use model, and eventually to one that will be free to Oomf Customers through engaged advertising experiences, our sales docs have seen a lot of edits. That's what the alpha model was and what beta is for though, refining these details before we go global at a massive scale.
[THE DESIGN] From a design standpoint, Oomf needed to be user-friendly and attractive. Keeping everything Oomf customers loved about the product (mainly the portability), we cleaned up the mess of attachable cables with a shift into an all-in-one device, with dual charging ports. It makes it extremely manageable for both Oomf PowerHouses and users. 
[THE BRAND] The name was the first thing to tackle. Starting as PowerUp Chargers, shifting to IonRecharge then finally landing on Oomf within the first week of hiring Jennie. Focused on being a wise source for creating transformational moments for people in search for power, Oomf strives for an intangible, magical presence--deeply connected with the human condition.
[THE SALES] Less of a pivot and more of an evolution, our sales team loves securing Oomf PowerHouses because it's so easy, with our new Oomf product model. We have a 90% success rate in just over a month of pre-sales. 300 Oomf PowerHouses are signed up and ready to go.

OUR VISION
To change commerce, by exchanging branded experiences for goods and services of present, tangible value.               Risks & Challenges  As a startup we are familiar with the many challenges and obstacles that can arise along the way, but you can rest easy knowing the team that makes Oomf possible is one you can trust to deliver. Once funded, we'll be setting up nearly 300 businesses, locally to provide Oomf charging to their customers. Our organizational efforts thus far give us confidence in being able to deliver on our mission in a timely manner. We'll continually update our community of backers if anything arises in which may cause a delay. Thank you all for truly believing in our project!   Other Ways You Can Help This is truly a product for the people, so please help us spread the word about Oomf and use Indiegogo's sharing tools to help us tell everyone that a better way to recharge is on the way!

story:
Toolo is a non-profit, community focused artist run initiative that aims to provide people with a workspace, tools and training. It is about sharing community resources so everyone can benefit. People will pay an annual subscription which will give them access to every tool in the tool library, which will include art tools like weaving machines, welding equipment, building DIY tools such as carpentry equipment. As well as in time a media centre that will give people access to computer software for art and design purposes.

It’s about giving creative people, artists, DIY enthusiasts, entrepreneurs, inventors, hobbyist, tinkerers or anyone who does occasional home improvements an affordable accessible way to create their ideas. A place where people can learn new skills, use professional equipment and experiment within a supportive environment.

We aim through this Indigogo to sell memberships and therefore raise the funds to set up this tool library, people that contribute via being our first members will get two years membership instead of one as a thank you for their trust and support during this initial set up phase.

Benefits of being a member are-

  • You will have access to professional equipment which most people could not afford as an individual.

  • You will have access to the Toolo workspace

  • It is more affordable than traditional tool rental, as we have a flat yearly membership fee which does not matter how many tools you borrow.

  • You can experiment with tools to see if you like that hobby without laying out any private money to acquire that tool.

  • You have access to our tool related skill and project workshops.

  • Your creative skills will develop in a supportive environment

  • Meet like-minded people that love creativity and inspiring each other

  • You don’t have to store the tools when not in use.

Other Ways You Can Help

As well as joining Toolo as a member you can also contribute by donating tool or by volunteering your time.

story:
The Llion X is a very small,form factor pc, that is capable of gaming.The machine itself is  not bigger than a console and can be hooked up to your tv or can be used as a normal pc on your desktop.The mainboard inside this awesome machine will be either a Nano ITX or a Mini ATX board running an  AMD  A10 7890k  APU clocked @4.3 ghz and 16gb of RAM (Random Access Memory).Also wifi and bluetooth will also be added so you can  connect our device to any home network or connect wireless devices like a mouse or a keyboard.Now what is a APU you ask? An APU is a computer processor that already has integrated graphics inside it so no other extra graphics card is needed. The AMD A10 7890k multicore processor is a highly capable cpu that can t ake any task you throw at it but is optimized for gaming. The System itself will have Windows 8 preinstalled with upgradebility to Windows 10! Here are some specs: 

-AMD APU(CPU+GPU): AMD 7890k clocked @4.3ghz

-Memory(RAM): 16gb @ 1600mhz dual channel 

-Storage(SSD): Intel SSD with 128gb 

- Wifi 802(B,G,N) standard 

-Bluetooth 

-OS(Operating System: Windows 8 upgadeable to Windows 10

-A custom case to hold everything together

RISKS:

After funding is finished, we will directly start building our beautiful machines and deliver it to your home !

A prototype will soon be shown in the updates with pictures and a video :D

story:
Sounderr: Amplifies your life

Sounderr collects and redirects all "lost-to-air" sound from the loudspeakers by a 90 degrees angle towards you.

Our product makes a big change in your everyday life! Watching a video on your smartphone or tablet with Sounderr will be a better experience than ever before. Order yours now and help to spread the word!

 

 

What does Sounderr give to you?

  • Makes the volume louder on your phone or tablet
  • Makes the sound richer
  • Decreases the disturbance of others around you by screening the sound only to you directly
  • Elevates your experience of watching videos or listening to music

 

How does it work?

Sounderr works incredibly easily. It stands in the way of the sound coming from the loudspeaker of your phone/tablet and redirects it with a 90 degrees angle direct to your ears. It is not a device connected to the phone or tablet. It is a ‘shader’ which is designed to reflect as much sound as possible.

 

 

Test it now with your palms

 

You can easily test how the Sounderr makes your phone sound better. Have a look at our photo here and place your palm to your phone the same way you see here. It is very important not to cover the loudspeakers, but simply act as though it as a shader. Be sure that the surrounding sound is not too noisy so that you can clearly hear the difference.

 

 

Please note, that this test with your palm will not have the same effect as Sounderr will. Sounderr sounds much better! This test is simply to show you the way it works.

 

About this idea

  • Being a smartphone and tablet user daily myself, I never understood why the loudspeakers are placed on the lower edge of the devices these days. You are never in the best position for it to be in the way of the sound coming from the speaker- these are “lost-to-air” sounds, which disturb others around you who don’t need to hear what you are watching or listening to. Sounderr is a  solution to this, as it directs the sounds only to you decreasing the “spread” noise to others around you.
  • Success on Indiegogo is important for us because we would like to make the Sounderr available for as many different types of phones and tablets as possible. Each device has the speakers positioned in a slightly different way- therefore, we want to design and produce Sounderr the best way possible in order to give you the best experience when using it.

 

Will it fit and work with my device?

Sounderr does NOT make any connection with your phone or tablet. It is fixed through the charging connection but it uses it just as a fixation point. It makes no connection with the devices itself as it is not an electrical product.

We design and deliver Sounderr with 3 connection types: Apple Lightning, Micro USB and USB Type-C connections. All Sounderrs are delivered with the ability to attach all three of these connection types to the device.

 

What we need

We need your support by pre-ordering our product!

  • We are a small budget campaign. Our $15,000 USD goal is easier to reach if you spread our idea around and join the pre-orders now.
  • Christmas is coming! Don’t hesitate to buy more Sounderrs (have a look at our perks) and give them to your friends or family as a gadget gift. Everyone will love its features.
  • Even if we do not reach our goal we will make the Sounderr anyway but it will take a longer period of time. Your contribution helps us to make it happen sooner and gives us feedback about our product. Do you like our product? Don’t hesitate to tell us your thoughts by ordering or leaving a comment.

 

The future

Sounderr is really a great product but we have further goals to reach. Our passion is to develop Sounderr so it can be better and better, finding the best materials and best shape for a perfect sound-reflecting shader for smartphones and tablets. In 10 years we want to see people lying on their towels on the beach next to each other, watching different videos on their device with the maximum experiment without earplugs and without disturbing each other’s experience, hearing the noise of the waves of the ocean at the same time. Give us the chance to start a several-years-in-the-making development for something that will soon be a must for everyone to have in their pocket. Give us the chance to have a better user experience and zero surrounding disturbance of smartphones and tablets.

 

 

How can you participate?

We are more than glad, more than happy if you choose any of our perks. Please have a look on our perk table (or on the right side) to see how you can be a Sounderr owner soon.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are more than pleased to have your help on our campaign with your support and your comments. Do you have a blog? We would be really grateful if you could please share our idea there! It would be incredible if you could please share it with your friends on Facebook, Twitter or your preferred sharing platform.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

What is the Sounderr used for?

Sounderr is designed to redirect the sound of your phone/tablet by a 90 degrees angle to you. Phones and tablets have their loudspeakers positioned on their bottom edge nowadays. This makes a lot of sound to loose “to the air”. All what Sounderr does is to redirect these “to-loose” sounds to you.

 

What is the effect of the Sounderr?

Using a Sounderr you will experience a richer, more precise, louder sound. Also the more sound that is directed straight to you, the less sound is directed to everyone around you, thus not disturbing others around you.

 

How does it work?

It works like a shader but is designed to be as good a sound director as possible. The surface, material and material thickness is also crucial in having the best sound reflection. This is a key component of the Sounderr. It works in a really easy way by standing in the way of the sound coming from the loudspeaker of your phone/tablet and forcing it to change direction to you!

 

How is it fixed?

Sounderr is designed to be fixed to your device through the charging plug. For iPhones and iPads, this means to be fitting it to the Lightning connection and on other smartphones it means a USB plug.

 

 

Is it connected to the phone/tablet?

No. It makes no connection with your phone/tablet, as there is no electrical part. We use the charging plug to fix the Sounderr’s position but it makes no connection with the phone/tablet itself.

 

Can the device be broken into?

Absolutely not! Sounderr is designed very carefully and focused to absolutely exclude the risk of any breaking The connection part of the Sounderr is the strongest point of the whole item so the last place to be broken is the fixation point.

 

What kind of phones can I use it for?

We are delivering Sounderr with 3 mountings. Apple Lightning, Micro USB and USB Type-C. You can use the Sounderr regardless of which connection you have on your device. All Sounderr are delivered with all the three connections.

 

When is it going to be shipped?

Development of the Sounderr is at the last stage. We are waiting for our contributors to tell us their thoughts and to give us feedback about the product. After receiving this, we will finalize the Sounderr to be as good as possible and then we will start mass production.

 

Can I buy the Sounderr outside of Indiegogo?

No, Sounderr can be ordered only through Indiegogo until the mass production starts. Should you wish to order a Sounderr after the campaign has ended, please visit our website: www.sounderr.com

 

Are you sure we need the Sounderr?

For sure! But you can also easily test how the Sounderr makes your phone sound better. Have a look at our photo here and place your palm to your phone the same way you see here. It is very important not to cover the loudspeakers, but simply act as though it as a shader. Be sure that the surrounding sound is not too noisy so that you can clearly hear the difference.

Should you wish to order a Sounderr after the campaign has ended, please visit our website: www.sounderr.com Are you sure we need the Sounderr?For sure! But you can also easily test how the Sounderr makes your phone sound better. Have a look at our photo here and place your palm to your phone the same way you see here. It is very important not to cover the loudspeakers, but simply act as though it as a shader. Be sure that the surrounding sound is not too noisy so that you can clearly hear the difference.

story:
Short Summary

     My name is Daksh Pandya. I have started a bootstrapped company called Ekraft. You will find many free games published by us. All you need to do is search for Ekraft in the Apple App Store and Google Play. Digidice compatible Apps have also been launched on the Android play Store. Our most popular games are: Snakes & Ladders Board Game (the traditional Indian Board Game) - 600 k Download on Android; and, Ludo (the traditional Indian Board Game) - 150 k Download on Android.

     I invented Digidice which communicates and interacts with your Smart phone. Now you can play with actual dice on your smart phones. Over the last year, I have consciously worked hard to get this product market-ready from a paper prototype to a 3d printed prototype to a final Molded Finished Product. 

     Ekraft is a bootstrapped company, so in order to reduce the cost price of the Digidice I need to manufacture this product in bulk. I will be using the Amount funded to manufacture in Bulk quantities to reduce the Cost per unit. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break down in more detail:

Raise $100K to fund the manufacturing of the bulk quantity and build more compatible content to Digidice. Will also need to make new version of Digidice which is Compatible to both Android and IOS and smaller in size.

You get  Digidice and Tshirts as perks.

We will utilize the funds to manufacture Digidice in Smaller quantities which would increase per unit cost if the campaign is partly funded.

The Impact

Traditionally Games played in groups were more interactive. But when the group plays on mobile it appears more isolated as everyone is glued to their individual devices. Now we are trying to bridge the  gap between the traditional ways and the modern ways by integrating a real dice to the Smart phone through Digidice.

Successfully, I have run my start up since 2012 without raising any external funds for our games across platforms which have crossed 2.9 million Downloads.

Risks & Challenges

Mobile App and Services is not as capital incentive as creating and manufacturing a product. The production Cycle involves:

1) PCB designing 

2) PCB Soldering

3) Case Molding

4) Loading the micro-controller program

5) Testing

6) Assemble

7) Final QC 

Each of these Stages have been Successfully  Completed but we have to put same effort in to manufacturing 1000 units or 10000 units and at lower volume the cost remains high and not feasible in the long term.

Other Ways You Can Help

Would love to hear from you! Have constructive feedback for us, please share.

Do try out our Casual games on Apple App Store and Android Play Store.

 Share our innovation on your Social Media.
